verses.translation: He who thus vows his soul to the Supreme Soul, quitting sin, passes unhindered to the endless bliss of unity with Brahma.
verses.teaching: Steadily practicing yoga thus, the yogi, freed from contamination, easily attains infinite bliss through contact with Brahman. Consistent practice removes all obstacles.

verses.sanskrit: सर्वभूतस्थमात्मानं सर्वभूतानि चात्मनि। ईक्षते योगयुक्तात्मा सर्वत्र समदर्शनः॥
verses.transliteration: sarva-bhūta-stham ātmānaṁ sarva-bhūtāni cātmani | īkṣate yoga-yuktātmā sarvatra sama-darśanaḥ ||
verses.translation: He so vowed, so blended, sees the Life-Soul resident in all things living, and all living things in that Life-Soul contained.
verses.teaching: One who is established in union with the divine Self sees the Self present in all beings and all beings in the Self. Such a person sees with equal vision everywhere. This is the vision of unity.

verses.sanskrit: यो मां पश्यति सर्वत्र सर्वं च मयि पश्यति। तस्याहं न प्रणश्यामि स च मे न प्रणश्यति॥
verses.transliteration: yo māṁ paśyati sarvatra sarvaṁ ca mayi paśyati | tasyāhaṁ na praṇaśyāmi sa ca me na praṇaśyati ||
verses.translation: And whoso thus discerneth Me in all, and all in Me, I never let him go; nor looseneth he hold upon Me; but, dwell he where he may, whate'er his life, in Me he dwells and lives, because he knows and worships Me, Who dwell in all which lives.
verses.teaching: For one who sees Me everywhere and sees everything in Me, I am never lost, nor is that person ever lost to Me. This is the eternal relationship between the devotee and the Divine—inseparable and unbreakable.

verses.sanskrit: सर्वभूतस्थितं यो मां भजत्येकत्वमास्थितः। सर्वथा वर्तमानोऽपि स योगी मयि वर्तते॥
verses.transliteration: sarva-bhūta-sthitaṁ yo māṁ bhajaty ekatvam āsthitaḥ | sarvathā vartamāno 'pi sa yogī mayi vartate ||
verses.translation: Arjuna! if a man sees everywhere—taught by his own similitude—one Life, one Essence in the Evil and the Good, hold him a Yogi, yea! well-perfected!
verses.teaching: One who, established in unity, worships Me dwelling in all beings—whatever the mode of living of such a yogi—lives in Me. True devotion recognizes the Divine presence everywhere.

verses.sanskrit: आत्मौपम्येन सर्वत्र समं पश्यति योऽर्जुन। सुखं वा यदि वा दुःखं स योगी परमो मतः॥
verses.transliteration: ātmaupamyena sarvatra samaṁ paśyati yo 'rjuna | sukhaṁ vā yadi vā duḥkhaṁ sa yogī paramo mataḥ ||
verses.translation: Arjuna! if a man sees everywhere—taught by his own similitude—one Life, one Essence in the Evil and the Good, hold him a Yogi, yea! well-perfected!
verses.teaching: One who sees, through comparison with the self, equality everywhere, O Arjuna—whether pleasure or pain—that yogi is considered supreme. Empathy and equal vision are the highest attainment.

verses.sanskrit: अर्जुन उवाच योऽयं योगस्त्वया प्रोक्तः साम्येन मधुसूदन। एतस्याहं न पश्यामि चञ्चलत्वात्स्थितिं स्थिराम्॥
verses.transliteration: arjuna uvāca yo 'yaṁ yogas tvayā proktaḥ sāmyena madhusūdana | etasyāhaṁ na paśyāmi cañcalatvāt sthitiṁ sthirām ||
verses.translation: Slayer of Madhu! yet again, this Yog, this Peace, derived from equanimity, made known by thee—I see no fixity therein, no rest, because the heart of men is unfixed, Krishna! rash, tumultuous, wilful and strong.
verses.teaching: Arjuna said: O Madhusudana, the yoga of equanimity You have described—I do not see how this can have lasting stability, due to the restlessness of the mind. Arjuna voices the universal struggle with the wandering mind.

verses.sanskrit: चञ्चलं हि मनः कृष्ण प्रमाथि बलवद्दृढम्। तस्याहं निग्रहं मन्ये वायोरिव सुदुष्करम्॥
verses.transliteration: cañcalaṁ hi manaḥ kṛṣṇa pramāthi balavad dṛḍham | tasyāhaṁ nigrahaṁ manye vāyor iva su-duṣkaram ||
verses.translation: It were all one, I think, to hold the wayward wind, as tame man's heart.
verses.teaching: The mind is restless, turbulent, powerful, and obstinate, O Krishna. I consider it as difficult to control as the wind. This honest admission reflects the challenge every spiritual seeker faces.

verses.sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच असंशयं महाबाहो मनो दुर्निग्रहं चलम्। अभ्यासेन तु कौन्तेय वैराग्येण च गृह्यते॥
verses.transliteration: śrī-bhagavān uvāca asaṁśayaṁ mahā-bāho mano durnigrahaṁ calam | abhyāsena tu kaunteya vairāgyeṇa ca gṛhyate ||
verses.translation: Hero long-armed! beyond denial, hard man's heart is to restrain, and wavering; yet may it grow restrained by habit, Prince! by wont of self-command.
verses.teaching: The Supreme Lord said: Undoubtedly, O mighty-armed, the mind is restless and difficult to control. But it can be controlled, O son of Kunti, by practice and detachment. The solution: consistent practice and non-attachment.

verses.sanskrit: असंयतात्मना योगो दुष्प्राप इति मे मतिः। वश्यात्मना तु यतता शक्योऽवाप्तुमुपायतः॥
verses.transliteration: asaṁyatātmanā yogo duṣprāpa iti me matiḥ | vaśyātmanā tu yatatā śakyo 'vāptum upāyataḥ ||
verses.translation: This Yog, I say, cometh not lightly to th' ungoverned ones; but he who will be master of himself shall win it, if he stoutly strive thereto.
verses.teaching: Yoga is difficult to attain for one whose mind is not controlled. But for one who strives with a controlled mind, success is assured through proper means. Self-mastery is achievable through effort.

verses.sanskrit: अर्जुन उवाच अयतिः श्रद्धयोपेतो योगाच्चलितमानसः। अप्राप्य योगसंसिद्धिं कां गतिं कृष्ण गच्छति॥
verses.transliteration: arjuna uvāca ayatiḥ śraddhayopeto yogāc calita-mānasaḥ | aprāpya yoga-saṁsiddhiṁ kāṁ gatiṁ kṛṣṇa gacchati ||
verses.translation: And what road goeth he who, having faith, fails, Krishna! in the striving; falling back from holiness, missing the perfect rule?
verses.teaching: Arjuna said: One who is unsuccessful in yoga, though possessing faith, whose mind falls away from yoga without attaining perfection—what destination does such a person reach, O Krishna? A crucial question about incomplete spiritual progress.

verses.sanskrit: कच्चिन्नोभयविभ्रष्टश्छिन्नाभ्रमिव नश्यति। अप्रतिष्ठो महाबाहो विमूढो ब्रह्मणः पथि॥
verses.transliteration: kaccin nobhaya-vibhraṣṭaś chinnābhram iva naśyati | apratiṣṭho mahā-bāho vimūḍho brahmaṇaḥ pathi ||
verses.translation: Is he not lost, straying from Brahma's light, like the vain cloud, which floats 'twixt earth and heaven when lightning splits it, and it vanisheth?
verses.teaching: Does such a person, fallen from both paths, O mighty-armed, not perish like a scattered cloud, without support, bewildered on the path to Brahman? The fear of spiritual failure expressed.

verses.sanskrit: एतन्मे संशयं कृष्ण छेत्तुमर्हस्यशेषतः। त्वदन्यः संशयस्यास्य छेत्ता न ह्युपपद्यते॥
verses.transliteration: etan me saṁśayaṁ kṛṣṇa chettum arhasy aśeṣataḥ | tvad-anyaḥ saṁśayasyāsya chettā na hy upapadyate ||
verses.translation: Fain would I hear thee answer me herein, since, Krishna! none save thou can clear the doubt.
verses.teaching: This is my doubt, O Krishna, and I ask You to dispel it completely. Other than You, no one is capable of destroying this doubt. Only the Divine can answer the deepest spiritual questions.

verses.sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच पार्थ नैवेह नामुत्र विनाशस्तस्य विद्यते। न हि कल्याणकृत्कश्चिद्दुर्गतिं तात गच्छति॥
verses.transliteration: śrī-bhagavān uvāca pārtha naiveha nāmutra vināśas tasya vidyate | na hi kalyāṇa-kṛt kaścid durgatiṁ tāta gacchati ||
verses.translation: He is not lost, thou Son of Pritha! No! nor earth, nor heaven is forfeit, even for him, because no heart that holds one right desire treadeth the road of loss!
verses.teaching: The Supreme Lord said: O Partha, neither in this world nor in the next is there destruction for such a person. No one who does good, dear friend, ever comes to a bad end. The most reassuring verse in the Gita!

verses.sanskrit: प्राप्य पुण्यकृतां लोकानुषित्वा शाश्वतीः समाः। शुचीनां श्रीमतां गेहे योगभ्रष्टोऽभिजायते॥
verses.transliteration: prāpya puṇya-kṛtāṁ lokān uṣitvā śāśvatīḥ samāḥ | śucīnāṁ śrīmatāṁ gehe yoga-bhraṣṭo 'bhijāyate ||
verses.translation: He who should fail, desiring righteousness, cometh at death unto the Region of the Just; dwells there measureless years, and being born anew, beginneth life again in some fair home amid the mild and happy.
verses.teaching: The unsuccessful yogi attains the worlds of the righteous, and after dwelling there for countless years, is born in a house of the pure and prosperous. Spiritual effort is never wasted.

verses.sanskrit: अथवा योगिनामेव कुले भवति धीमताम्। एतद्धि दुर्लभतरं लोके जन्म यदीदृशम्॥
verses.transliteration: atha vā yoginām eva kule bhavati dhīmatām | etad dhi durlabhataraṁ loke janma yad īdṛśam ||
verses.translation: It may chance he doth descend into a Yogin house on Virtue's breast; but that is rare! Such birth is hard to be obtained on this earth, Chief!
verses.teaching: Or one is born directly into a family of wise yogis. But such a birth is very rare in this world. Being born into a spiritual family is a special blessing earned through past efforts.

verses.sanskrit: तत्र तं बुद्धिसंयोगं लभते पौर्वदेहिकम्। यतते च ततो भूयः संसिद्धौ कुरुनन्दन॥
verses.transliteration: tatra taṁ buddhi-saṁyogaṁ labhate paurva-dehikam | yatate ca tato bhūyaḥ saṁsiddhau kuru-nandana ||
verses.translation: So hath he back again what heights of heart he did achieve, and so he strives anew to perfectness, with better hope, dear Prince!
verses.teaching: There one regains the knowledge cultivated in the previous life, O joy of the Kurus, and strives even harder toward perfection. Past spiritual progress is never lost—it continues in the next life.

verses.sanskrit: पूर्वाभ्यासेन तेनैव ह्रियते ह्यवशोऽपि सः। जिज्ञासुरपि योगस्य शब्दब्रह्मातिवर्तते॥
verses.transliteration: pūrvābhyāsena tenaiva hriyate hy avaśo 'pi saḥ | jijñāsur api yogasya śabda-brahmātivartate ||
verses.translation: For by the old desire he is drawn on unwittingly; and, only to desire the purity of Yog is to pass beyond the Sabdabrahm, the spoken Ved.
verses.teaching: By virtue of that previous practice, one is irresistibly carried forward. Even one who merely inquires about yoga transcends the ritualistic principles of scriptures. Past spiritual momentum creates future spiritual attraction.

verses.sanskrit: प्रयत्नाद्यतमानस्तु योगी संशुद्धकिल्बिषः। अनेकजन्मसंसिद्धस्ततो याति परां गतिम्॥
verses.transliteration: prayatnād yatamānas tu yogī saṁśuddha-kilbiṣaḥ | aneka-janma-saṁsiddhas tato yāti parāṁ gatim ||
verses.translation: But, being Yogi, striving strong and long, purged from transgressions, perfected by births following on births, he plants his feet at last upon the farther path.
verses.teaching: But the yogi who strives with effort, purified of all sins, perfected through many births, then attains the supreme goal. Persistent effort across lifetimes leads to ultimate success.

verses.sanskrit: तपस्विभ्योऽधिको योगी ज्ञानिभ्योऽपि मतोऽधिकः। कर्मिभ्यश्चाधिको योगी तस्माद्योगी भवार्जुन॥
verses.transliteration: tapasvibhyo 'dhiko yogī jñānibhyo 'pi mato 'dhikaḥ | karmibhyaś cādhiko yogī tasmād yogī bhavārjuna ||
verses.translation: Such as one ranks above ascetics, higher than the wise, beyond achievers of vast deeds! Be thou Yogi Arjuna!
verses.teaching: The yogi is greater than the ascetics, greater even than the scholars, and greater than the performers of ritualistic actions. Therefore, O Arjuna, be a yogi! This summarizes the superiority of yoga practice.

verses.sanskrit: योगिनामपि सर्वेषां मद्गतेनान्तरात्मना। श्रद्धावान्भजते यो मां स मे युक्ततमो मतः॥
verses.transliteration: yoginām api sarveṣāṁ mad-gatenāntar-ātmanā | śraddhāvān bhajate yo māṁ sa me yuktatamo mataḥ ||
verses.translation: And of such believe, truest and best is he who worships Me with inmost soul, stayed on My Mystery!
verses.teaching: And among all yogis, the one who worships Me with faith, with inner self absorbed in Me—that person is considered by Me to be the most perfect yogi. Devotional yoga is the highest form of all yogas.

verses.sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच मय्यासक्तमनाः पार्थ योगं युञ्जन्मदाश्रयः। असंशयं समग्रं मां यथा ज्ञास्यसि तच्छृणु॥
verses.transliteration: śrī-bhagavān uvāca mayy āsakta-manāḥ pārtha yogaṁ yuñjan mad-āśrayaḥ | asaṁśayaṁ samagraṁ māṁ yathā jñāsyasi tac chṛṇu ||
verses.translation: Learn now, dear Prince! how, if thy soul be set ever on Me—still exercising Yog, still making Me thy Refuge—thou shalt come most surely unto perfect hold of Me.
verses.teaching: The Supreme Lord said: Now hear, O Partha, how by practicing yoga with mind attached to Me and taking refuge in Me, you will know Me completely, without doubt. Complete knowledge of God comes through devoted practice.

verses.sanskrit: ज्ञानं तेऽहं सविज्ञानमिदं वक्ष्याम्यशेषतः। यज्ज्ञात्वा नेह भूयोऽन्यज्ज्ञातव्यमवशिष्यते॥
verses.transliteration: jñānaṁ te 'haṁ sa-vijñānam idaṁ vakṣyāmy aśeṣataḥ | yaj jñātvā neha bhūyo 'nyaj jñātavyam avaśiṣyate ||
verses.translation: I will declare to thee that utmost lore, whole and particular, which, when thou knowest, leaveth no more to know here in this world.
verses.teaching: I shall teach you this knowledge along with realization in full, knowing which nothing further remains to be known. Theoretical knowledge combined with experiential wisdom is complete knowledge.

verses.sanskrit: मनुष्याणां सहस्रेषु कश्चिद्यतति सिद्धये। यततामपि सिद्धानां कश्चिन्मां वेत्ति तत्त्वतः॥
verses.transliteration: manuṣyāṇāṁ sahasreṣu kaścid yatati siddhaye | yatatām api siddhānāṁ kaścin māṁ vetti tattvataḥ ||
verses.translation: Of many thousand mortals, one, perchance, striveth for Truth; and of those few that strive—nay, and rise high—one only—here and there—knoweth Me, as I am, the very Truth.
verses.teaching: Among thousands of people, scarcely one strives for perfection. And among those who strive and succeed, scarcely one knows Me in truth. Self-realization is rare because it requires extraordinary dedication.

verses.sanskrit: भूमिरापोऽनलो वायुः खं मनो बुद्धिरेव च। अहङ्कार इतीयं मे भिन्ना प्रकृतिरष्टधा॥
verses.transliteration: bhūmir āpo 'nalo vāyuḥ khaṁ mano buddhir eva ca | ahaṅkāra itīyaṁ me bhinnā prakṛtir aṣṭadhā ||
verses.translation: Earth, water, flame, air, ether, life, and mind, and individuality—those eight make up the showing of Me, Manifest.
verses.teaching: Earth, water, fire, air, space, mind, intelligence, and ego—these eight constitute My separated material energy. Understanding the elements helps us see beyond them to the Divine.

verses.sanskrit: अपरेयमितस्त्वन्यां प्रकृतिं विद्धि मे पराम्। जीवभूतां महाबाहो ययेदं धार्यते जगत्॥
verses.transliteration: apareyam itas tv anyāṁ prakṛtiṁ viddhi me parām | jīva-bhūtāṁ mahā-bāho yayedaṁ dhāryate jagat ||
verses.translation: These be my lower Nature; learn the higher, whereby, thou Valiant One! this Universe is, by its principle of life, produced; whereby the worlds of visible things are born as from a Yoni.
verses.teaching: This is My lower nature. But beyond this, O mighty-armed, know My superior nature—the life force by which this universe is sustained. Spirit animates matter.

verses.sanskrit: एतद्योनीनि भूतानि सर्वाणीत्युपधारय। अहं कृत्स्नस्य जगतः प्रभवः प्रलयस्तथा॥
verses.transliteration: etad-yonīni bhūtāni sarvāṇīty upadhāraya | ahaṁ kṛtsnasya jagataḥ prabhavaḥ pralayas tathā ||
verses.translation: Know! I am that womb: I make and I unmake this Universe: than me there is no other Master, Prince! No other Maker!
verses.teaching: Understand that all beings have their source in these two natures. I am the origin of the entire universe and also its dissolution. God is both the source and end of all existence.

verses.sanskrit: मत्तः परतरं नान्यत्किञ्चिदस्ति धनञ्जय। मयि सर्वमिदं प्रोतं सूत्रे मणिगणा इव॥
verses.transliteration: mattaḥ parataraṁ nānyat kiñcid asti dhanañjaya | mayi sarvam idaṁ protaṁ sūtre maṇi-gaṇā iva ||
verses.translation: All these hang on me as hangs a row of pearls upon its string. I am the fresh taste of the water; I the silver of the moon, the gold o' the sun, the word of worship in the Veds, the thrill that passeth in the ether, and the strength of man's shed seed.
verses.teaching: There is nothing whatsoever higher than Me, O Dhananjaya. All this universe is strung on Me like pearls on a thread. Everything exists in relation to the Divine center.

verses.sanskrit: रसोऽहमप्सु कौन्तेय प्रभास्मि शशिसूर्ययोः। प्रणवः सर्ववेदेषु शब्दः खे पौरुषं नृषु॥
verses.transliteration: raso 'ham apsu kaunteya prabhāsmi śaśi-sūryayoḥ | praṇavaḥ sarva-vedeṣu śabdaḥ khe pauruṣaṁ nṛṣu ||
verses.translation: I am the fresh taste of the water; I the silver of the moon, the gold o' the sun, the word of worship in the Veds, the thrill that passeth in the ether, and the strength of man's shed seed.
verses.teaching: I am the taste in water, O son of Kunti, the light in the moon and sun, the sacred syllable Om in the Vedas, the sound in space, and the ability in humans. God manifests as the essence in all phenomena.

verses.sanskrit: पुण्यो गन्धः पृथिव्यां च तेजश्चास्मि विभावसौ। जीवनं सर्वभूतेषु तपश्चास्मि तपस्विषु॥
verses.transliteration: puṇyo gandhaḥ pṛthivyāṁ ca tejaś cāsmi vibhāvasau | jīvanaṁ sarva-bhūteṣu tapaś cāsmi tapasviṣu ||
verses.translation: I am the good sweet smell of the moistened earth, I am the fire's red light, the vital air moving in all which moves, the holiness of hallowed souls, the root undying, whence hath sprung whatever is.
verses.teaching: I am the pure fragrance in earth and the brilliance in fire. I am the life in all living beings and the austerity in ascetics. The Divine essence permeates all aspects of existence.

verses.sanskrit: बीजं मां सर्वभूतानां विद्धि पार्थ सनातनम्। बुद्धिर्बुद्धिमतामस्मि तेजस्तेजस्विनामहम्॥
verses.transliteration: bījaṁ māṁ sarva-bhūtānāṁ viddhi pārtha sanātanam | buddhir buddhimatām asmi tejas tejasvinām aham ||
verses.translation: The wisdom of the wise, the intellect of the informed, the greatness of the great, the splendour of the splendid, Kunti's Son! these am I, free from passion and desire.
verses.teaching: Know Me, O Partha, to be the eternal seed of all beings. I am the intelligence of the intelligent and the prowess of the powerful. God is the source of all positive qualities.

verses.sanskrit: बलं बलवतां चाहं कामरागविवर्जितम्। धर्माविरुद्धो भूतेषु कामोऽस्मि भरतर्षभ॥
verses.transliteration: balaṁ balavatāṁ cāhaṁ kāma-rāga-vivarjitam | dharmāviruddho bhūteṣu kāmo 'smi bharatarṣabha ||
verses.translation: Yet am I right desire in all who yearn, Chief of the Bharatas! for all those moods, soothfast, or passionate, or ignorant, which Nature frames, deduce from me.
verses.teaching: I am the strength of the strong, devoid of desire and attachment. In beings, I am desire which is not contrary to dharma, O best of the Bharatas. Righteous desire aligned with duty is divine.

verses.sanskrit: ये चैव सात्त्विका भावा राजसास्तामसाश्च ये। मत्त एवेति तान्विद्धि न त्वहं तेषु ते मयि॥
verses.transliteration: ye caiva sāttvikā bhāvā rājasās tāmasāś ca ye | matta eveti tān viddhi na tv ahaṁ teṣu te mayi ||
verses.translation: For all those moods, soothfast, or passionate, or ignorant, which Nature frames, deduce from me; but all are merged in me—not I in them!
verses.teaching: Know that all states of being—goodness, passion, and ignorance—arise from Me alone. But I am not in them; they are in Me. God transcends the modes while being their source.

verses.sanskrit: त्रिभिर्गुणमयैर्भावैरेभिः सर्वमिदं जगत्। मोहितं नाभिजानाति मामेभ्यः परमव्ययम्॥
verses.transliteration: tribhir guṇa-mayair bhāvair ebhiḥ sarvam idaṁ jagat | mohitaṁ nābhijānāti mām ebhyaḥ param avyayam ||
verses.translation: The world—deceived by those three qualities of being—wotteth not Me Who am outside them all, above them all, Eternal!
verses.teaching: Deluded by these three modes of material nature, the entire world does not recognize Me, who am beyond them and imperishable. The modes create a veil that obscures our vision of the Divine.

verses.sanskrit: दैवी ह्येषा गुणमयी मम माया दुरत्यया। मामेव ये प्रपद्यन्ते मायामेतां तरन्ति ते॥
verses.transliteration: daivī hy eṣā guṇa-mayī mama māyā duratyayā | mām eva ye prapadyante māyām etāṁ taranti te ||
verses.translation: Hard it is to pierce that veil divine of various shows which hideth Me; yet they who worship Me pierce it and pass beyond.
verses.teaching: This divine energy of Mine, consisting of the three modes, is difficult to overcome. But those who surrender unto Me can easily cross beyond it. Devotion is the key to transcending illusion.

verses.sanskrit: न मां दुष्कृतिनो मूढाः प्रपद्यन्ते नराधमाः। माययापहृतज्ञाना आसुरं भावमाश्रिताः॥
verses.transliteration: na māṁ duṣkṛtino mūḍhāḥ prapadyante narādhamāḥ | māyayāpahṛta-jñānā āsuraṁ bhāvam āśritāḥ ||
verses.translation: I am not known to evil-doers, nor to foolish ones, nor to the base and churlish; nor to those whose mind is cheated by the show of things, nor those that take the way of Asuras.
verses.teaching: Evildoers who are foolish, the lowest among people, whose knowledge is stolen by illusion, and who partake of a demoniac nature—such persons do not surrender to Me. Ignorance and wrongdoing create barriers to the Divine.

verses.sanskrit: चतुर्विधा भजन्ते मां जनाः सुकृतिनोऽर्जुन। आर्तो जिज्ञासुरर्थार्थी ज्ञानी च भरतर्षभ॥
verses.transliteration: catur-vidhā bhajante māṁ janāḥ sukṛtino 'rjuna | ārto jijñāsur arthārthī jñānī ca bharatarṣabha ||
verses.translation: Four sorts of mortals know me: he who weeps, Arjuna! and the man who yearns to know; and he who toils to help; and he who sits certain of me, enlightened.
verses.teaching: Four kinds of virtuous people worship Me, O Arjuna: the distressed, the seeker of knowledge, the seeker of wealth, and the wise. People approach God for different reasons, and all are valid starting points.

verses.sanskrit: तेषां ज्ञानी नित्ययुक्त एकभक्तिर्विशिष्यते। प्रियो हि ज्ञानिनोऽत्यर्थमहं स च मम प्रियः॥
verses.transliteration: teṣāṁ jñānī nitya-yukta eka-bhaktir viśiṣyate | priyo hi jñānino 'tyartham ahaṁ sa ca mama priyaḥ ||
verses.translation: Of these four, highest, nearest, best that last is, the devout soul, wise, intent upon 'The One.' Dear, above all, am I to him; and he is dearest unto me!
verses.teaching: Among these, the wise one who is constantly united with Me in devotion and exclusive love excels. I am very dear to the wise, and they are very dear to Me. The relationship is mutual and intimate.

verses.sanskrit: उदाराः सर्व एवैते ज्ञानी त्वात्मैव मे मतम्। आस्थितः स हि युक्तात्मा मामेवानुत्तमां गतिम्॥
verses.transliteration: udārāḥ sarva evaite jñānī tv ātmaiva me matam | āsthitaḥ sa hi yuktātmā mām evānuttamāṁ gatim ||
verses.translation: All four are good, and seek me; but mine own, the true of heart, the faithful—stayed on me, taking me as their utmost blessedness, they are not 'mine,' but I—even I myself!
verses.teaching: All of them are indeed noble, but I consider the wise to be My very Self. For with mind steadfast, they are established in Me alone as the supreme goal. The wise devotee and God are one.

verses.sanskrit: बहूनां जन्मनामन्ते ज्ञानवान्मां प्रपद्यते। वासुदेवः सर्वमिति स महात्मा सुदुर्लभः॥
verses.transliteration: bahūnāṁ janmanām ante jñānavān māṁ prapadyate | vāsudevaḥ sarvam iti sa mahātmā su-durlabhaḥ ||
verses.translation: At end of many births to Me they come! Yet hard the wise Mahatma is to find, that man who sayeth, 'All is Vasudev!'
verses.teaching: After many births, one of true knowledge surrenders unto Me, knowing 'Vasudeva is everything.' Such a great soul is very rare. This realization is the culmination of spiritual evolution.

verses.sanskrit: कामैस्तैस्तैर्हृतज्ञानाः प्रपद्यन्तेऽन्यदेवताः। तं तं नियममास्थाय प्रकृत्या नियताः स्वया॥
verses.transliteration: kāmais tais tair hṛta-jñānāḥ prapadyante 'nya-devatāḥ | taṁ taṁ niyamam āsthāya prakṛtyā niyatāḥ svayā ||
verses.translation: There be those, too, whose knowledge, turned aside by this desire or that, gives them to serve some lower gods, with various rites, constrained by that which mouldeth them.
verses.teaching: Those whose wisdom has been carried away by various desires surrender to other gods, following particular rules and regulations according to their own nature. Desires shape our spiritual choices.

verses.sanskrit: यो यो यां यां तनुं भक्तः श्रद्धयार्चितुमिच्छति। तस्य तस्याचलां श्रद्धां तामेव विदधाम्यहम्॥
verses.transliteration: yo yo yāṁ yāṁ tanuṁ bhaktaḥ śraddhayārcitum icchati | tasya tasyācalāṁ śraddhāṁ tām eva vidadhāmy aham ||
verses.translation: Unto all such—worship what shrine they will, what shapes, in faith—'tis I who give them faith! I am content!
verses.teaching: Whatever form a devotee with faith wishes to worship, I make that very faith of theirs steady and unflinching. God supports all sincere seekers regardless of their chosen path.

verses.sanskrit: स तया श्रद्धया युक्तस्तस्याराधनमीहते। लभते च ततः कामान्मयैव विहितान्हि तान्॥
verses.transliteration: sa tayā śraddhayā yuktas tasyārādhanam īhate | labhate ca tataḥ kāmān mayaiva vihitān hi tān ||
verses.translation: The heart thus asking favour from its God, darkened but ardent, hath the end it craves, the lesser blessing—but 'tis I who give!
verses.teaching: Endowed with that faith, they seek to propitiate that deity and obtain their desires, which are indeed granted by Me alone. All blessings ultimately come from the Supreme.

verses.sanskrit: अन्तवत्तु फलं तेषां तद्भवत्यल्पमेधसाम्। देवान्देवयजो यान्ति मद्भक्ता यान्ति मामपि॥
verses.transliteration: antavat tu phalaṁ teṣāṁ tad bhavaty alpa-medhasām | devān deva-yajo yānti mad-bhaktā yānti mām api ||
verses.translation: Yet soon is withered what small fruit they reap: those men of little minds, who worship so, go where they worship, passing with their gods. But Mine come unto me!
verses.teaching: But the fruits gained by these people of small understanding are temporary. Those who worship the gods go to the gods, but My devotees come to Me. Finite worship yields finite results; infinite devotion yields infinity.

verses.sanskrit: अव्यक्तं व्यक्तिमापन्नं मन्यन्ते मामबुद्धयः। परं भावमजानन्तो ममाव्ययमनुत्तमम्॥
verses.transliteration: avyaktaṁ vyaktim āpannaṁ manyante mām abuddhayaḥ | paraṁ bhāvam ajānanto mamāvyayam anuttamam ||
verses.translation: Blind are the eyes which deem th' Unmanifested manifest, not comprehending Me in my true Self! Imperishable, viewless, undeclared, hidden behind my magic veil of shows, I am not seen by all; I am not known—unborn and changeless—to the idle world.
verses.teaching: The unintelligent think that I, the unmanifest, have assumed manifestation, not knowing My supreme nature, which is imperishable and unsurpassed. They mistake the limited form for the unlimited essence.

verses.sanskrit: नाहं प्रकाशः सर्वस्य योगमायासमावृतः। मूढोऽयं नाभिजानाति लोको मामजमव्ययम्॥
verses.transliteration: nāhaṁ prakāśaḥ sarvasya yoga-māyā-samāvṛtaḥ | mūḍho 'yaṁ nābhijānāti loko mām ajam avyayam ||
verses.translation: Hidden behind my magic veil of shows, I am not seen by all; I am not known—unborn and changeless—to the idle world.
verses.teaching: Veiled by My divine power of illusion, I am not revealed to everyone. This deluded world does not know Me, the unborn and imperishable. Divine maya conceals the Divine from ordinary perception.

verses.sanskrit: वेदाहं समतीतानि वर्तमानानि चार्जुन। भविष्याणि च भूतानि मां तु वेद न कश्चन॥
verses.transliteration: vedāhaṁ samatītāni vartamānāni cārjuna | bhaviṣyāṇi ca bhūtāni māṁ tu veda na kaścana ||
verses.translation: But I, Arjuna! know all things which were, and all which are, and all which are to be, albeit not one among them knoweth Me!
verses.teaching: I know all beings of the past, present, and future, O Arjuna. But no one knows Me. God's omniscience is complete while we remain limited in our understanding.

verses.sanskrit: इच्छाद्वेषसमुत्थेन द्वन्द्वमोहेन भारत। सर्वभूतानि सम्मोहं सर्गे यान्ति परन्तप॥
verses.transliteration: icchā-dveṣa-samutthena dvandva-mohena bhārata | sarva-bhūtāni sammohaṁ sarge yānti parantapa ||
verses.translation: By passion for the 'pairs of opposites,' by those twain snares of Like and Dislike, Prince! all creatures live bewildered, save some few who, quit of sins, holy in act, informed, freed from the 'opposites,' and fixed in faith, cleave unto Me.
verses.teaching: O descendant of Bharata, all beings are born into delusion, bewildered by the dualities of desire and aversion that arise from illusion. The pairs of opposites trap us in confusion.

verses.sanskrit: येषां त्वन्तगतं पापं जनानां पुण्यकर्मणाम्। ते द्वन्द्वमोहनिर्मुक्ता भजन्ते मां दृढव्रताः॥
verses.transliteration: yeṣāṁ tv anta-gataṁ pāpaṁ janānāṁ puṇya-karmaṇām | te dvandva-moha-nirmuktā bhajante māṁ dṛḍha-vratāḥ ||
verses.translation: Who cleave, who seek in Me refuge from birth and death, those have the Truth! Those know Me BRAHMA; know Me Soul of Souls, the ADHYATMAN; know KARMA, my work.
verses.teaching: But those persons of virtuous deeds whose sins have come to an end, freed from the delusion of dualities, worship Me with firm resolve. Purity and virtue enable one to transcend duality.

verses.sanskrit: जरामरणमोक्षाय मामाश्रित्य यतन्ति ये। ते ब्रह्म तद्विदुः कृत्स्नमध्यात्मं कर्म चाखिलम्॥
verses.transliteration: jarā-maraṇa-mokṣāya mām āśritya yatanti ye | te brahma tad viduḥ kṛtsnam adhyātmaṁ karma cākhilam ||
verses.translation: Who cleave, who seek in Me refuge from birth and death, those have the Truth! Those know Me BRAHMA; know Me Soul of Souls, the ADHYATMAN; know KARMA, my work.
verses.teaching: Those who strive for liberation from old age and death, taking refuge in Me, know Brahman entirely, the Self, and all about action. Seeking refuge in God leads to complete knowledge.

verses.sanskrit: साधिभूताधिदैवं मां साधियज्ञं च ये विदुः। प्रयाणकालेऽपि च मां ते विदुर्युक्तचेतसः॥
verses.transliteration: sādhibhūtādhidaivaṁ māṁ sādhiyajñaṁ ca ye viduḥ | prayāṇa-kāle 'pi ca māṁ te vidur yukta-cetasaḥ ||
verses.translation: Know I am ADHIBHUTA, Lord of Life, and ADHIDAIVA, Lord of all the Gods, and ADHIYAJNA, Lord of Sacrifice; worship Me well, with hearts of love and faith, and find and hold me in the hour of death.
verses.teaching: Those who know Me as the Supreme governing the material manifestation, the celestial gods, and sacrifices—with minds absorbed in Me—know Me even at the time of death. Constant remembrance ensures awareness at death.

verses.sanskrit: अर्जुन उवाच किं तद्ब्रह्म किमध्यात्मं किं कर्म पुरुषोत्तम। अधिभूतं च किं प्रोक्तमधिदैवं किमुच्यते॥
verses.transliteration: arjuna uvāca kiṁ tad brahma kim adhyātmaṁ kiṁ karma puruṣottama | adhibhūtaṁ ca kiṁ proktam adhidaivaṁ kim ucyate ||
verses.translation: Who is that BRAHMA? What that Soul of Souls, the ADHYATMAN? What, Thou Best of All! Thy work, the KARMA? Tell me what it is Thou namest ADHIBHUTA?
verses.teaching: Arjuna said: O Supreme Person, what is Brahman? What is the Self? What is action? What is the material manifestation? And what are the gods? Arjuna seeks clarification of the technical terms Krishna used.

verses.sanskrit: अधियज्ञः कथं कोऽत्र देहेऽस्मिन्मधुसूदन। प्रयाणकाले च कथं ज्ञेयोऽसि नियतात्मभिः॥
verses.transliteration: adhiyajñaḥ kathaṁ ko 'tra dehe 'smin madhusūdana | prayāṇa-kāle ca kathaṁ jñeyo 'si niyatātmabhiḥ ||
verses.translation: What again means ADHIDAIVA? Yea, and how it comes Thou canst be ADHIYAJNA in thy flesh? Slayer of Madhu! Further, make me know how good men find thee in the hour of death?
verses.teaching: Who is the Lord of sacrifice, and how does He dwell in this body, O Madhusudana? And how are You to be known at the time of death by the self-controlled? These questions address the practical aspects of spiritual knowledge.

verses.sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच अक्षरं ब्रह्म परमं स्वभावोऽध्यात्ममुच्यते। भूतभावोद्भवकरो विसर्गः कर्मसंज्ञितः॥
verses.transliteration: śrī-bhagavān uvāca akṣaraṁ brahma paramaṁ svabhāvo 'dhyātmam ucyate | bhūta-bhāvodbhava-karo visargaḥ karma-saṁjñitaḥ ||
verses.translation: I BRAHMA am! the One Eternal GOD, and ADHYATMAN is My Being's name, the Soul of Souls! What goeth forth from Me, causing all life to live, is KARMA called.
verses.teaching: The Supreme Lord said: The imperishable Brahman is the supreme absolute truth. The individual soul is called the Self. Action pertaining to the development of material bodies is called karma. Fundamental definitions clarify confusion.

verses.sanskrit: अधिभूतं क्षरो भावः पुरुषश्चाधिदैवतम्। अधियज्ञोऽहमेवात्र देहे देहभृतां वर॥
verses.transliteration: adhibhūtaṁ kṣaro bhāvaḥ puruṣaś cādhidaivatam | adhiyajño 'ham evātra dehe deha-bhṛtāṁ vara ||
verses.translation: And, Manifested in divided forms, I am the ADHIBHUTA, Lord of Lives; and ADHIDAIVA, Lord of all the Gods, because I am PURUSHA, who begets. And ADHIYAJNA, Lord of Sacrifice, I—speaking with thee in this body here—am, thou embodied one!
verses.teaching: The physical nature is the perishable. The universal form of the Lord is the supreme among gods. And I am the Lord of sacrifice, here in this body, O best of embodied beings. God is present within as the witness of sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit: अन्तकाले च मामेव स्मरन्मुक्त्वा कलेबरम्। यः प्रयाति स मद्भावं याति नास्त्यत्र संशयः॥
verses.transliteration: anta-kāle ca mām eva smaran muktvā kalevaram | yaḥ prayāti sa mad-bhāvaṁ yāti nāsty atra saṁśayaḥ ||
verses.translation: For all the shrines flame unto Me! And, at the hour of death, he that hath meditated Me alone, in putting off his flesh, comes forth to Me, enters into My Being—doubt thou not!
verses.teaching: Whoever, at the end of life, remembering Me alone, departs from the body, attains My nature—of this there is no doubt. The state of consciousness at death determines the next state.

verses.sanskrit: यं यं वापि स्मरन्भावं त्यजत्यन्ते कलेबरम्। तं तमेवैति कौन्तेय सदा तद्भावभावितः॥
verses.transliteration: yaṁ yaṁ vāpi smaran bhāvaṁ tyajaty ante kalevaram | taṁ tam evaiti kaunteya sadā tad-bhāva-bhāvitaḥ ||
verses.translation: But, if he meditated otherwise at hour of death, in putting off the flesh, he goes to what he looked for, Kunti's Son! Because the Soul is fashioned to its like.
verses.teaching: Whatever state of being one remembers when leaving the body, O son of Kunti, that state one will attain without fail, being always absorbed in that thought. We become what we think about.

verses.sanskrit: तस्मात्सर्वेषु कालेषु मामनुस्मर युध्य च। मय्यर्पितमनोबुद्धिर्मामेवैष्यस्यसंशयः॥
verses.transliteration: tasmāt sarveṣu kāleṣu mām anusmara yudhya ca | mayy arpita-mano-buddhir mām evaiṣyasy asaṁśayaḥ ||
verses.translation: Have Me, then, in thy heart always! and fight! Thou too, when heart and mind are fixed on Me, shalt surely come to Me! All come who cleave with never-wavering will of firmest faith, owning none other Gods: all come to Me, the Uttermost, Purusha, Holiest!
verses.teaching: Therefore, remember Me at all times and fight. With mind and intellect fixed on Me, you will surely come to Me without doubt. Constant remembrance combined with duty is the path.

verses.sanskrit: अभ्यासयोगयुक्तेन चेतसा नान्यगामिना। परमं पुरुषं दिव्यं याति पार्थानुचिन्तयन्॥
verses.transliteration: abhyāsa-yoga-yuktena cetasā nānya-gāminā | paramaṁ puruṣaṁ divyaṁ yāti pārthānucintayan ||
verses.translation: Whoso hath known Me, Lord of sage and singer, ancient of days; of all the Three Worlds Stay, boundless,—but unto every atom Bringer of that which quickens it: whoso, I say, hath known My form, which passeth mortal knowing.
verses.teaching: One who meditates on Me as the Supreme Divine Person with mind engaged in the yoga of practice and not deviating to anything else, O Partha, reaches Me. Consistent practice creates unwavering focus.

verses.sanskrit: कविं पुराणमनुशासितारमणोरणीयांसमनुस्मरेद्यः। सर्वस्य धातारमचिन्त्यरूपमादित्यवर्णं तमसः परस्तात्॥
verses.transliteration: kaviṁ purāṇam anuśāsitāram aṇor aṇīyāṁsam anusmared yaḥ | sarvasya dhātāram acintya-rūpam āditya-varṇaṁ tamasaḥ parastāt ||
verses.translation: Whoso hath known Me, Lord of sage and singer, ancient of days; of all the Three Worlds Stay, boundless,—but unto every atom Bringer of that which quickens it: whoso, I say, hath known My form, which passeth mortal knowing; seen my effulgence—which no eye hath seen—than the sun's burning gold more brightly glowing, dispersing darkness.
verses.teaching: One should meditate on the all-knowing, the ancient, the ruler, smaller than the smallest, the sustainer of all, of inconceivable form, luminous like the sun, beyond darkness. Meditation on divine qualities elevates consciousness.

verses.sanskrit: प्रयाणकाले मनसाचलेन भक्त्या युक्तो योगबलेन चैव। भ्रुवोर्मध्ये प्राणमावेश्य सम्यक् स तं परं पुरुषमुपैति दिव्यम्॥
verses.transliteration: prayāṇa-kāle manasācalena bhaktyā yukto yoga-balena caiva | bhruvor madhye prāṇam āveśya samyak sa taṁ paraṁ puruṣam upaiti divyam ||
verses.translation: Unto him, in the hour when life is ending, with mind set fast and trustful piety, drawing still breath beneath calm brows unbending, in happy peace that faithful one doth die,—in glad peace passeth to Purusha's heaven.
verses.teaching: At the time of death, with an undeviating mind, endowed with devotion and the power of yoga, fixing the life force between the eyebrows, one attains that Supreme Divine Person. Yogic practice prepares for the final moment.

verses.sanskrit: यदक्षरं वेदविदो वदन्ति विशन्ति यद्यतयो वीतरागाः। यदिच्छन्तो ब्रह्मचर्यं चरन्ति तत्ते पदं संग्रहेण प्रवक्ष्ये॥
verses.transliteration: yad akṣaraṁ veda-vido vadanti viśanti yad yatayo vīta-rāgāḥ | yad icchanto brahmacaryaṁ caranti tat te padaṁ saṅgraheṇa pravakṣye ||
verses.translation: The place which they who read the Vedas name AKSHARAM, 'Ultimate;' whereto have striven saints and ascetics—their road is the same. That way—the highest way—goes he who shuts the gates of all his senses, locks desire safe in his heart, centres the vital airs upon his parting thought, steadfastly set.
verses.teaching: That imperishable goal which the knowers of the Vedas declare, which ascetics freed from attachment enter, and desiring which seekers practice celibacy—that goal I will briefly explain to you. The supreme destination requires purity.

verses.sanskrit: सर्वद्वाराणि संयम्य मनो हृदि निरुध्य च। मूर्ध्न्याधायात्मनः प्राणमास्थितो योगधारणाम्॥
verses.transliteration: sarva-dvārāṇi saṁyamya mano hṛdi nirudhya ca | mūrdhny ādhāyātmanaḥ prāṇam āsthito yoga-dhāraṇām ||
verses.translation: And, murmuring OM, the sacred syllable—emblem of BRAHM—dies, meditating Me. For who, none other Gods regarding, looks ever to Me, easily am I gained by such a Yogi; and, attaining Me, they fall not—those Mahatmas—back to birth, to life, which is the place of pain, which ends, but take the way of utmost blessedness.
verses.teaching: Closing all the gates of the body, confining the mind in the heart, fixing the life force at the top of the head, established in yogic concentration—this is the preparation for departure.

verses.sanskrit: ओमित्येकाक्षरं ब्रह्म व्याहरन्मामनुस्मरन्। यः प्रयाति त्यजन्देहं स याति परमां गतिम्॥
verses.transliteration: om ity ekākṣaraṁ brahma vyāharan mām anusmaran | yaḥ prayāti tyajan dehaṁ sa yāti paramāṁ gatim ||
verses.translation: And, murmuring OM, the sacred syllable—emblem of BRAHM—dies, meditating Me. For who, none other Gods regarding, looks ever to Me, easily am I gained by such a Yogi.
verses.teaching: Uttering the single syllable Om, the Brahman, and remembering Me while departing from the body, one attains the supreme goal. Om is the sonic representation of the absolute.

verses.sanskrit: अनन्यचेताः सततं यो मां स्मरति नित्यशः। तस्याहं सुलभः पार्थ नित्ययुक्तस्य योगिनः॥
verses.transliteration: ananya-cetāḥ satataṁ yo māṁ smarati nityaśaḥ | tasyāhaṁ sulabhaḥ pārtha nitya-yuktasya yoginaḥ ||
verses.translation: For who, none other Gods regarding, looks ever to Me, easily am I gained by such a Yogi; and, attaining Me, they fall not—those Mahatmas—back to birth, to life, which is the place of pain, which ends, but take the way of utmost blessedness.
verses.teaching: For one who always thinks of Me with undivided mind, who is constantly engaged, I am easily attainable, O Partha. Constant remembrance makes God easily accessible.

verses.sanskrit: मामुपेत्य पुनर्जन्म दुःखालयमशाश्वतम्। नाप्नुवन्ति महात्मानः संसिद्धिं परमां गताः॥
verses.transliteration: mām upetya punar janma duḥkhālayam aśāśvatam | nāpnuvanti mahātmānaḥ saṁsiddhiṁ paramāṁ gatāḥ ||
verses.translation: And, attaining Me, they fall not—those Mahatmas—back to birth, to life, which is the place of pain, which ends, but take the way of utmost blessedness.
verses.teaching: Having attained Me, these great souls do not undergo rebirth, which is the abode of misery and is impermanent. They have reached the highest perfection. Liberation means freedom from the cycle of birth and death.

verses.sanskrit: आब्रह्मभुवनाल्लोकाः पुनरावर्तिनोऽर्जुन। मामुपेत्य तु कौन्तेय पुनर्जन्म न विद्यते॥
verses.transliteration: ā-brahma-bhuvanāl lokāḥ punar āvartino 'rjuna | mām upetya tu kaunteya punar janma na vidyate ||
verses.translation: The worlds, Arjuna!—even Brahma's world—roll back again from Death to Life's unrest; but they, O Kunti's Son! that reach to Me, taste birth no more.
verses.teaching: From the world of Brahma down to earth, all worlds are subject to return, O Arjuna. But having reached Me, O son of Kunti, there is no rebirth. Even heavenly realms are temporary compared to ultimate liberation.

verses.sanskrit: सहस्रयुगपर्यन्तमहर्यद्ब्रह्मणो विदुः। रात्रिं युगसहस्रान्तां तेऽहोरात्रविदो जनाः॥
verses.transliteration: sahasra-yuga-paryantam ahar yad brahmaṇo viduḥ | rātriṁ yuga-sahasrāntāṁ te 'ho-rātra-vido janāḥ ||
verses.translation: If ye know that Brahma's Day endeth with the lapse of a thousand Yugas, and His Night with the ending of a thousand more: if thus ye know day, night, and the right sense of endless Life, and Life which hath an end, then shall ye know the Day and Night of Brahm!
verses.teaching: Those who know that Brahma's day lasts a thousand ages and his night lasts a thousand ages—they are the knowers of day and night. Cosmic time operates on scales beyond human comprehension.

verses.sanskrit: अव्यक्ताद्व्यक्तयः सर्वाः प्रभवन्त्यहरागमे। रात्र्यागमे प्रलीयन्ते तत्रैवाव्यक्तसंज्ञके॥
verses.transliteration: avyaktād vyaktayaḥ sarvāḥ prabhavanty ahar-āgame | rātry-āgame pralīyante tatraivāvyakta-saṁjñake ||
verses.translation: When that vast Dawn doth break, th' Invisible is brought anew into visible being; and all things spring from the Unmanifest; and when that deep Night doth darken, all things—evolved—fade back again to Him Who sent them forth.
verses.teaching: From the unmanifest all manifestations emerge at the coming of Brahma's day; at the coming of his night, they dissolve back into that alone which is called the unmanifest. Creation and dissolution cycle eternally.

verses.sanskrit: भूतग्रामः स एवायं भूत्वा भूत्वा प्रलीयते। रात्र्यागमेऽवशः पार्थ प्रभवत्यहरागमे॥
verses.transliteration: bhūta-grāmaḥ sa evāyaṁ bhūtvā bhūtvā pralīyate | rātry-āgame 'vaśaḥ pārtha prabhavaty ahar-āgame ||
verses.translation: Yea! this vast company of living things—brought forth again, and yet again dissolved—helplessly is dissolved when Night comes, and helplessly to being comes, when that Day dawneth which opens the eyes of men.
verses.teaching: This same multitude of beings, having come into existence repeatedly, dissolves helplessly at the coming of night, O Partha, and emerges at the coming of day. All beings are subject to these cosmic cycles.

verses.sanskrit: परस्तस्मात्तु भावोऽन्योऽव्यक्तोऽव्यक्तात्सनातनः। यः स सर्वेषु भूतेषु नश्यत्सु न विनश्यति॥
verses.transliteration: paras tasmāt tu bhāvo 'nyo 'vyakto 'vyaktāt sanātanaḥ | yaḥ sa sarveṣu bhūteṣu naśyatsu na vinaśyati ||
verses.translation: Yet, Higher, Beyond, Above, the Manifest, the Unmanifest, there is another Life—not like the Life of sense—eternal, even for all those living things which pass away.
verses.teaching: Beyond this unmanifest, there is yet another unmanifest eternal being, which does not perish when all beings perish. There exists a transcendent reality beyond even cosmic cycles.

verses.sanskrit: अव्यक्तोऽक्षर इत्युक्तस्तमाहुः परमां गतिम्। यं प्राप्य न निवर्तन्ते तद्धाम परमं मम॥
verses.transliteration: avyakto 'kṣara ity uktas tam āhuḥ paramāṁ gatim | yaṁ prāpya na nivartante tad dhāma paramaṁ mama ||
verses.translation: It is named the Unmanifest—the Unreversed! They call it the Highest Road, from whence there is no return. That is My dwelling-place.
verses.teaching: That unmanifest is called the imperishable; that is declared to be the supreme goal. Having reached it, one does not return—that is My supreme abode. This is the ultimate destination beyond all cycles.

verses.sanskrit: पुरुषः स परः पार्थ भक्त्या लभ्यस्त्वनन्यया। यस्यान्तःस्थानि भूतानि येन सर्वमिदं ततम्॥
verses.transliteration: puruṣaḥ sa paraḥ pārtha bhaktyā labhyas tv ananyayā | yasyāntaḥ-sthāni bhūtāni yena sarvam idaṁ tatam ||
verses.translation: That Ultimate God, Arjuna! is won by worship lonely-souled, deep-hearted, trusting; He Who holds all living things enwrapt in Him, spread through all Nature, Lord of all and Master!
verses.teaching: That Supreme Person, O Partha, is attained by unswerving devotion alone, within whom all beings exist and by whom all this is pervaded. Devotion is the means to reach the all-pervading Divine.

verses.sanskrit: यत्र काले त्वनावृत्तिमावृत्तिं चैव योगिनः। प्रयाता यान्ति तं कालं वक्ष्यामि भरतर्षभ॥
verses.transliteration: yatra kāle tv anāvṛttim āvṛttiṁ caiva yoginaḥ | prayātā yānti taṁ kālaṁ vakṣyāmi bharatarṣabha ||
verses.translation: Hear, too, of times which bring to passing hence him who goeth thither whence return is not, and him who journeyeth back to Life, great Prince!
verses.teaching: I will now declare to you, O best of the Bharatas, the times at which yogis departing do not return, and also the times when they return. Different times of departure affect the soul's journey.

verses.sanskrit: अग्निर्ज्योतिरहः शुक्लः षण्मासा उत्तरायणम्। तत्र प्रयाता गच्छन्ति ब्रह्म ब्रह्मविदो जनाः॥
verses.transliteration: agnir jyotir ahaḥ śuklaḥ ṣaṇ-māsā uttarāyaṇam | tatra prayātā gacchanti brahma brahma-vido janāḥ ||
verses.translation: By flame and light, by day, the bright fortnight, the six months when the sun goeth north—nay, in that fair time of snow and flowers—hence passing, the wise seek Brahm, and Brahm they find!
verses.teaching: Fire, light, daytime, the bright fortnight, the six months of the sun's northern course—departing then, knowers of Brahman go to Brahman. The path of light leads to non-return.

verses.sanskrit: धूमो रात्रिस्तथा कृष्णः षण्मासा दक्षिणायनम्। तत्र चान्द्रमसं ज्योतिर्योगी प्राप्य निवर्तते॥
verses.transliteration: dhūmo rātris tathā kṛṣṇaḥ ṣaṇ-māsā dakṣiṇāyanam | tatra cāndra-masaṁ jyotir yogī prāpya nivartate ||
verses.translation: But, passing by the smoke, night, the dark half, the six months when the sun goeth south—so faring, the believing soul goes to the region of the Moon, and cometh to birth on earth anew.
verses.teaching: Smoke, night, the dark fortnight, the six months of the sun's southern course—attaining the lunar light, the yogi returns. The path of darkness leads to rebirth.

verses.sanskrit: शुक्लकृष्णे गती ह्येते जगतः शाश्वते मते। एकया यात्यनावृत्तिमन्ययावर्तते पुनः॥
verses.transliteration: śukla-kṛṣṇe gatī hy ete jagataḥ śāśvate mate | ekayā yāty anāvṛttim anyayāvartate punaḥ ||
verses.translation: Yea! the BRIGHT WAY and the DARK WAY—well known to all! By one—passing—men come not to mortal birth; but, passing by the other, they return.
verses.teaching: These two paths, the bright and the dark, are considered eternal for the world. By one, one goes not to return; by the other, one returns again. Two fundamental courses determine the soul's destiny.

verses.sanskrit: नैते सृती पार्थ जानन्योगी मुह्यति कश्चन। तस्मात्सर्वेषु कालेषु योगयुक्तो भवार्जुन॥
verses.transliteration: naite sṛtī pārtha jānan yogī muhyati kaścana | tasmāt sarveṣu kāleṣu yoga-yukto bhavārjuna ||
verses.translation: These being known—the bright, the dark—whoso is wise will not wax weak: be steadfast, Son of Bharata! cling to thy faith!
verses.teaching: Knowing these two paths, O Partha, no yogi is deluded. Therefore, at all times, be steadfast in yoga, O Arjuna. Knowledge of the paths prevents confusion and strengthens practice.

verses.sanskrit: वेदेषु यज्ञेषु तपःसु चैव दानेषु यत्पुण्यफलं प्रदिष्टम्। अत्येति तत्सर्वमिदं विदित्वा योगी परं स्थानमुपैति चाद्यम्॥
verses.transliteration: vedeṣu yajñeṣu tapaḥsu caiva dāneṣu yat puṇya-phalaṁ pradiṣṭam | atyeti tat sarvam idaṁ viditvā yogī paraṁ sthānam upaiti cādyam ||
verses.translation: For such an one shall win beyond those meedful prayers uttered by reading Veds, beyond gifts, penances, vows! Such an one shall pass the place of Sorrow, and attain the Place beyond all sorrow—Heaven's first, beginning Heaven!
verses.teaching: Knowing all this, the yogi transcends all the meritorious results prescribed for studying the Vedas, performing sacrifices, austerities, and giving charity, and attains the supreme primordial abode. True knowledge surpasses all ritual merit.

verses.sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच इदं तु ते गुह्यतमं प्रवक्ष्याम्यनसूयवे। ज्ञानं विज्ञानसहितं यज्ज्ञात्वा मोक्ष्यसेऽशुभात्॥
verses.transliteration: śrī-bhagavān uvāca idaṁ tu te guhyatamaṁ pravakṣyāmy anasūyave | jñānaṁ vijñāna-sahitaṁ yaj jñātvā mokṣyase 'śubhāt ||
verses.translation: Now will I open unto thee—whose heart rejects not—that last lore, deepest-concealed, that farthest secret of My Heavens and Earths, which but to know shall set thee free from ills,—
verses.teaching: The Supreme Lord said: To you who are not envious, I shall now impart the most confidential knowledge combined with realization, knowing which you shall be freed from the inauspicious. The highest knowledge liberates from all suffering.

verses.sanskrit: राजविद्या राजगुह्यं पवित्रमिदमुत्तमम्। प्रत्यक्षावगमं धर्म्यं सुसुखं कर्तुमव्ययम्॥
verses.transliteration: rāja-vidyā rāja-guhyaṁ pavitram idam uttamam | pratyakṣāvagamaṁ dharmyaṁ su-sukhaṁ kartum avyayam ||
verses.translation: A royal lore! a Kingly mystery! Yea! for the soul such light as purgeth it from every sin; a light of holiness with inmost splendour shining; plain to see; easy to walk by, inexhaustible!
verses.teaching: This is the king of knowledge, the king of secrets, supremely purifying, directly experienced, righteous, joyful to practice, and imperishable. This knowledge is the sovereign path to liberation.

verses.sanskrit: अश्रद्दधानाः पुरुषा धर्मस्यास्य परन्तप। अप्राप्य मां निवर्तन्ते मृत्युसंसारवर्त्मनि॥
verses.transliteration: aśraddadhānāḥ puruṣā dharmasyāsya parantapa | aprāpya māṁ nivartante mṛtyu-saṁsāra-vartmani ||
verses.translation: But they that will not hear, nor tryingly receive My truth, miss Me, and tread amiss; they shall not come to Me in any way, but wander every way through death!
verses.teaching: Those who have no faith in this dharma, O scorcher of foes, failing to attain Me, return to the path of the cycle of death and rebirth. Faith is essential for spiritual progress.

verses.sanskrit: मया ततमिदं सर्वं जगदव्यक्तमूर्तिना। मत्स्थानि सर्वभूतानि न चाहं तेष्ववस्थितः॥
verses.transliteration: mayā tatam idaṁ sarvaṁ jagad avyakta-mūrtinā | mat-sthāni sarva-bhūtāni na cāhaṁ teṣv avasthitaḥ ||
verses.translation: By Me all this vast Universe of things is spread abroad;—by Me, the Unmanifest! in Me are all existences; not I in them!
verses.teaching: By Me, in My unmanifest form, this entire universe is pervaded. All beings exist in Me, but I do not dwell in them. The Divine pervades all yet remains transcendent.

verses.sanskrit: न च मत्स्थानि भूतानि पश्य मे योगमैश्वरम्। भूतभृन्न च भूतस्थो ममात्मा भूतभावनः॥
verses.transliteration: na ca mat-sthāni bhūtāni paśya me yogam aiśvaram | bhūta-bhṛn na ca bhūta-stho mamātmā bhūta-bhāvanaḥ ||
verses.translation: Yet those exist not in Me! Behold this My divine mystery! I am not in them, but they in Me! Nay! I sustain them not! My Spirit maketh them! See how the wide winds rest in the vast sky, and, resting, move not! Even thus all things are in Me!
verses.teaching: And yet beings do not exist in Me—behold My divine yoga! Sustaining all beings but not dwelling in them, My Self causes beings to exist. The Divine paradox transcends ordinary logic.

verses.sanskrit: यथाकाशस्थितो नित्यं वायुः सर्वत्रगो महान्। तथा सर्वाणि भूतानि मत्स्थानीत्युपधारय॥
verses.transliteration: yathākāśa-sthito nityaṁ vāyuḥ sarvatra-go mahān | tathā sarvāṇi bhūtāni mat-sthānīty upadhāraya ||
verses.translation: See how the wide winds rest in the vast sky, and, resting, move not! Even thus all things are in Me!
verses.teaching: As the mighty wind, moving everywhere, perpetually dwells in space, so understand that all beings dwell in Me. Like wind in space, all existence rests in the Divine.

verses.sanskrit: सर्वभूतानि कौन्तेय प्रकृतिं यान्ति मामिकाम्। कल्पक्षये पुनस्तानि कल्पादौ विसृजाम्यहम्॥
verses.transliteration: sarva-bhūtāni kaunteya prakṛtiṁ yānti māmikām | kalpa-kṣaye punas tāni kalpādau visṛjāmy aham ||
verses.translation: At the beginning of each Kalp I make them all, and, at the end of every Kalp, all are folded up again and drawn into Me.
verses.teaching: All beings, O son of Kunti, merge into My nature at the end of a cosmic cycle, and at the beginning of the next cycle I send them forth again. Creation and dissolution follow eternal cycles.

verses.sanskrit: प्रकृतिं स्वामवष्टभ्य विसृजामि पुनः पुनः। भूतग्राममिमं कृत्स्नमवशं प्रकृतेर्वशात्॥
verses.transliteration: prakṛtiṁ svām avaṣṭabhya visṛjāmi punaḥ punaḥ | bhūta-grāmam imaṁ kṛtsnam avaśaṁ prakṛter vaśāt ||
verses.translation: At the beginning of each Kalp I make them all, and, at the end of every Kalp, all are folded up again and drawn into Me. By the might of My nature I make and mould and change and unmake again this vast multitude of lives, helpless all, borne forth by My Power.
verses.teaching: Taking hold of My own nature, I send forth again and again this entire multitude of beings, helpless under the control of nature. The Divine power governs the cosmic process.

verses.sanskrit: न च मां तानि कर्माणि निबध्नन्ति धनञ्जय। उदासीनवदासीनमसक्तं तेषु कर्मसु॥
verses.transliteration: na ca māṁ tāni karmāṇi nibadhnanti dhanañjaya | udāsīna-vad āsīnam asaktaṁ teṣu karmasu ||
verses.translation: Yet these great makings, Prince! wreak not on Me! As one unbound, unchanging, I live, untouch'd by deeds.
verses.teaching: But these actions do not bind Me, O Dhananjaya. I remain detached, seated like one indifferent, unattached to these actions. Divine action occurs without attachment or bondage.

verses.sanskrit: मयाध्यक्षेण प्रकृतिः सूयते सचराचरम्। हेतुनानेन कौन्तेय जगद्विपरिवर्तते॥
verses.transliteration: mayādhyakṣeṇa prakṛtiḥ sūyate sa-carācaram | hetunānena kaunteya jagad viparivartate ||
verses.translation: For I, the Lord of Life, my Maya sent into the world! whereby the universe hangs forth: it goeth round with stars and spaces, and things which seem,—ruled by the Mother of the World!
verses.teaching: Under My supervision, nature produces the moving and unmoving. By this cause, O son of Kunti, the universe revolves. The Divine oversees the cosmic dance of creation.

verses.sanskrit: अवजानन्ति मां मूढा मानुषीं तनुमाश्रितम्। परं भावमजानन्तो मम भूतमहेश्वरम्॥
verses.transliteration: avajānanti māṁ mūḍhā mānuṣīṁ tanum āśritam | paraṁ bhāvam ajānanto mama bhūta-maheśvaram ||
verses.translation: Yet know I how the darkened heart of man misprizes Me, descending in the form of Man; not knowing Me Most High, Lord of all being, Changeless and Eternal!
verses.teaching: Fools disregard Me when I appear in human form, not knowing My supreme nature as the great Lord of all beings. The ignorant fail to recognize the Divine in embodied form.

verses.sanskrit: मोघाशा मोघकर्माणो मोघज्ञाना विचेतसः। राक्षसीमासुरीं चैव प्रकृतिं मोहिनीं श्रिताः॥
verses.transliteration: moghāśā mogha-karmāṇo mogha-jñānā vicetasaḥ | rākṣasīm āsurīṁ caiva prakṛtiṁ mohinīṁ śritāḥ ||
verses.translation: Vain hopes pursuing, vain deeds doing; fed on vainest knowledge, senselessly they seek an evil way, the way of brutes and fiends.
verses.teaching: Of vain hopes, vain actions, vain knowledge, and senseless, they partake of the delusive nature of demons and devils. Those who reject the Divine fall into delusion.

verses.sanskrit: महात्मानस्तु मां पार्थ दैवीं प्रकृतिमाश्रिताः। भजन्त्यनन्यमनसो ज्ञात्वा भूतादिमव्ययम्॥
verses.transliteration: mahātmānas tu māṁ pārtha daivīṁ prakṛtim āśritāḥ | bhajanty ananya-manaso jñātvā bhūtādim avyayam ||
verses.translation: But My Mahatmas, those of noble soul who tread the path celestial, worship Me with hearts unwandering,—knowing Me the source, th' Eternal Source, of Life.
verses.teaching: But the great souls, O Partha, taking refuge in the divine nature, worship Me with undivided mind, knowing Me as the imperishable origin of all beings. The wise recognize and devote themselves to the Divine.

verses.sanskrit: सततं कीर्तयन्तो मां यतन्तश्च दृढव्रताः। नमस्यन्तश्च मां भक्त्या नित्ययुक्ता उपासते॥
verses.transliteration: satataṁ kīrtayanto māṁ yatantaś ca dṛḍha-vratāḥ | namasyantaś ca māṁ bhaktyā nitya-yuktā upāsate ||
verses.translation: Always they glorify Me; seek Me; keep their vows of reverence, worship Me with meditation firm and constant: so they love!
verses.teaching: Always chanting My glories, striving with firm resolve, bowing down to Me with devotion, perpetually steadfast, they worship Me. Constant devotion characterizes true seekers.

verses.sanskrit: ज्ञानयज्ञेन चाप्यन्ये यजन्तो मामुपासते। एकत्वेन पृथक्त्वेन बहुधा विश्वतोमुखम्॥
verses.transliteration: jñāna-yajñena cāpy anye yajanto mām upāsate | ekatvena pṛthaktvena bahudhā viśvato-mukham ||
verses.translation: And some, with minds fixed all on Me, as one with Me, receive with praise and worship Me; yet others worship Me all ways—and when they all are gathered into Me they worship Me, that One, from whose great face every way looketh, East and West and North and South.
verses.teaching: Others, sacrificing through the sacrifice of knowledge, worship Me as the one, as the distinct, and as the manifold, facing in all directions. The Divine can be approached through many paths.

verses.sanskrit: अहं क्रतुरहं यज्ञः स्वधाहमहमौषधम्। मन्त्रोऽहमहमेवाज्यमहमग्निरहं हुतम्॥
verses.transliteration: ahaṁ kratur ahaṁ yajñaḥ svadhāham aham auṣadham | mantro 'ham aham evājyam aham agnir ahaṁ hutam ||
verses.translation: I am the Sacrifice! I am the Prayer! I am the Funeral-Cake set for the dead! I am the healing herb! I am the ghee, the Mantra, and the Flame, and that which is consumed!
verses.teaching: I am the ritual, I am the sacrifice, I am the offering to ancestors, I am the medicinal herb, I am the sacred formula, I am the clarified butter, I am the fire, and I am the oblation. All aspects of worship are the Divine.

verses.sanskrit: पिताहमस्य जगतो माता धाता पितामहः। वेद्यं पवित्रमोंकार ऋक्साम यजुरेव च॥
verses.transliteration: pitāham asya jagato mātā dhātā pitāmahaḥ | vedyaṁ pavitram oṁkāra ṛk sāma yajur eva ca ||
verses.translation: I am the Father of this Universe, and Mother, and the Ancestor; I am the end of Learning; I am THAT which sanctifieth all! I am OM! I am RIG-VEDA, SAMA-VEDA, YAJUR-VED.
verses.teaching: I am the father of this world, the mother, the establisher, and the grandfather. I am the object of knowledge, the purifier, the syllable Om, and also the Rig, Sama, and Yajur Vedas. The Divine encompasses all relationships and sacred knowledge.

verses.sanskrit: गतिर्भर्ता प्रभुः साक्षी निवासः शरणं सुहृत्। प्रभवः प्रलयः स्थानं निधानं बीजमव्ययम्॥
verses.transliteration: gatir bhartā prabhuḥ sākṣī nivāsaḥ śaraṇaṁ suhṛt | prabhavaḥ pralayaḥ sthānaṁ nidhānaṁ bījam avyayam ||
verses.translation: I am the Way, the Master, the Witness, the Home, the Refuge, and the Friend! I am the source of Life and Treasure-House thereof; I sow the seed, and I the harvest reap; immortal Death am I, and Life immortal; I am what Is and what Is Not, Arjuna!
verses.teaching: I am the goal, the sustainer, the Lord, the witness, the abode, the refuge, the well-wisher; the origin, dissolution, and foundation; the treasure house and the imperishable seed. The Divine is all things to all beings.

verses.sanskrit: तपाम्यहमहं वर्षं निगृह्णाम्युत्सृजामि च। अमृतं चैव मृत्युश्च सदसच्चाहमर्जुन॥
verses.transliteration: tapāmy aham ahaṁ varṣaṁ nigṛhṇāmy utsṛjāmi ca | amṛtaṁ caiva mṛtyuś ca sad asac cāham arjuna ||
verses.translation: I am what Is and what Is Not, Arjuna! I the Sun am, and the Rain; I hold and I let drop the Rain; I am immortal Death, and Life immortal.
verses.teaching: I give heat; I withhold and send forth the rain. I am immortality and also death, being and non-being, O Arjuna. The Divine contains all opposites and dualities.

verses.sanskrit: त्रैविद्या मां सोमपाः पूतपापा यज्ञैरिष्ट्वा स्वर्गतिं प्रार्थयन्ते। ते पुण्यमासाद्य सुरेन्द्रलोकमश्नन्ति दिव्यान्दिवि देवभोगान्॥
verses.transliteration: trai-vidyā māṁ soma-pāḥ pūta-pāpā yajñair iṣṭvā svar-gatiṁ prārthayante | te puṇyam āsādya surendra-lokam aśnanti divyān divi deva-bhogān ||
verses.translation: And those whose minds are set on worldly righteousness, paying strict rites to Me, drinking the Soma-wine, being purged from sin, pray that I lead them to the dwelling-place of Indra; where, arrived, they enter into Paradise, and eat the fruit of glory with the gods.
verses.teaching: The knowers of the three Vedas, who drink soma and are cleansed of sin, worshipping Me through sacrifices, seek passage to heaven. Having reached the holy world of Indra, they enjoy the celestial pleasures of the gods. Ritualistic worship leads to temporary heavenly rewards.

verses.sanskrit: ते तं भुक्त्वा स्वर्गलोकं विशालं क्षीणे पुण्ये मर्त्यलोकं विशन्ति। एवं त्रयीधर्ममनुप्रपन्ना गतागतं कामकामा लभन्ते॥
verses.transliteration: te taṁ bhuktvā svarga-lokaṁ viśālaṁ kṣīṇe puṇye martya-lokaṁ viśanti | evaṁ trayī-dharmam anuprapannā gatāgataṁ kāma-kāmā labhante ||
verses.translation: Yet is their bliss not perfect! Nay, it ends! And they pass back to Jiva life again! They who will cleave to changeful things, who crave the threefold lore, come and go.
verses.teaching: Having enjoyed that vast world of heaven, when their merit is exhausted, they enter the world of mortals. Thus, following the doctrine of the three Vedas and desiring desires, they attain the state of going and returning. Temporary pleasures lead back to rebirth.

verses.sanskrit: अनन्याश्चिन्तयन्तो मां ये जनाः पर्युपासते। तेषां नित्याभियुक्तानां योगक्षेमं वहाम्यहम्॥
verses.transliteration: ananyāś cintayanto māṁ ye janāḥ paryupāsate | teṣāṁ nityābhiyuktānāṁ yoga-kṣemaṁ vahāmy aham ||
verses.translation: But to those blessed ones who worship Me, turning not otherwhere, with minds set fast, I bring assurance of full bliss beyond.
verses.teaching: To those who worship Me alone, thinking of no other, to those ever steadfast, I secure what is not already possessed and preserve what they already have. The Divine cares for those devoted exclusively.

verses.sanskrit: येऽप्यन्यदेवताभक्ता यजन्ते श्रद्धयान्विताः। तेऽपि मामेव कौन्तेय यजन्त्यविधिपूर्वकम्॥
verses.transliteration: ye 'py anya-devatā-bhaktā yajante śraddhayānvitāḥ | te 'pi mām eva kaunteya yajanty avidhi-pūrvakam ||
verses.translation: Nay, and of those who pay their vows to lower Gods in simple faith, 'tis I who take the gifts and own the sacrifice; for all paths, Arjuna! are My way.
verses.teaching: Even those who are devotees of other gods and worship them with faith, they also worship Me alone, O son of Kunti, though not according to the proper method. All worship ultimately reaches the one Divine.

verses.sanskrit: अहं हि सर्वयज्ञानां भोक्ता च प्रभुरेव च। न तु मामभिजानन्ति तत्त्वेनातश्च्यवन्ति ते॥
verses.transliteration: ahaṁ hi sarva-yajñānāṁ bhoktā ca prabhur eva ca | na tu mām abhijānanti tattvenātaś cyavanti te ||
verses.translation: Yet such shall fall to lives of men and death; for they pray mistakingly, missing Me, Who am, in truth, the Lord of Sacrifice.
verses.teaching: For I am the enjoyer and the Lord of all sacrifices; but they do not know Me in truth, and therefore they fall. Those who worship without true knowledge eventually return to the cycle of birth and death.

verses.sanskrit: यान्ति देवव्रता देवान्पितॄन्यान्ति पितृव्रताः। भूतानि यान्ति भूतेज्या यान्ति मद्याजिनोऽपि माम्॥
verses.transliteration: yānti deva-vratā devān pitṝn yānti pitṛ-vratāḥ | bhūtāni yānti bhūtejyā yānti mad-yājino 'pi mām ||
verses.translation: They that worship the Gods shall go to them; they that worship my Pitris shall go to the Pitris; unto the demons go the demon-worshippers; and whoso worship Me come unto Me.
verses.teaching: Those devoted to the gods go to the gods; those devoted to the ancestors go to the ancestors; those devoted to spirits go to spirits; and those who worship Me come to Me. Each person reaches the object of their devotion.

verses.sanskrit: पत्रं पुष्पं फलं तोयं यो मे भक्त्या प्रयच्छति। तदहं भक्त्युपहृतमश्नामि प्रयतात्मनः॥
verses.transliteration: patraṁ puṣpaṁ phalaṁ toyaṁ yo me bhaktyā prayacchati | tad ahaṁ bhakty-upahṛtam aśnāmi prayatātmanaḥ ||
verses.translation: He who shall offer Me in faith and love a leaf, a flower, a fruit, water poured forth, that offering I accept, lovingly made with pious will.
verses.teaching: Whoever offers Me with devotion a leaf, a flower, a fruit, or water—that I accept, offered with devotion by the pure-hearted. Simple offerings given with devotion are accepted by the Divine.

verses.sanskrit: यत्करोषि यदश्नासि यज्जुहोषि ददासि यत्। यत्तपस्यसि कौन्तेय तत्कुरुष्व मदर्पणम्॥
verses.transliteration: yat karoṣi yad aśnāsi yaj juhoṣi dadāsi yat | yat tapasyasi kaunteya tat kuruṣva mad-arpaṇam ||
verses.translation: Whate'er thou doest, Prince! eating or sacrificing, giving gifts, praying or fasting, let it all be done for Me, as Mine.
verses.teaching: Whatever you do, whatever you eat, whatever you offer in sacrifice, whatever you give away, whatever austerity you practice, O son of Kunti, do that as an offering to Me. All actions can become acts of worship.

verses.sanskrit: शुभाशुभफलैरेवं मोक्ष्यसे कर्मबन्धनैः। संन्यासयोगयुक्तात्मा विमुक्तो मामुपैष्यसि॥
verses.transliteration: śubhāśubha-phalair evaṁ mokṣyase karma-bandhanaiḥ | sannyāsa-yoga-yuktātmā vimukto mām upaiṣyasi ||
verses.translation: So shalt thou quit the Karmaphala—fruit-giving bonds of the Yoke of works, with heart set fast on Renunciation, and shalt come to Me! attaining freedom.
verses.teaching: Thus you shall be freed from the bondage of actions yielding good and evil results. With your mind fixed in the yoga of renunciation, liberated, you shall come to Me. Offering all actions liberates from karma.

verses.sanskrit: समोऽहं सर्वभूतेषु न मे द्वेष्योऽस्ति न प्रियः। ये भजन्ति तु मां भक्त्या मयि ते तेषु चाप्यहम्॥
verses.transliteration: samo 'haṁ sarva-bhūteṣu na me dveṣyo 'sti na priyaḥ | ye bhajanti tu māṁ bhaktyā mayi te teṣu cāpy aham ||
verses.translation: I am alike for all! I know not hate, I know not favour! What is made is Mine! But them that worship Me with love, I love; they are in Me, and I in them!
verses.teaching: I am equal to all beings; none is hateful to Me nor dear. But those who worship Me with devotion, they are in Me and I am in them. The Divine is impartial but responds to devotion.

verses.sanskrit: अपि चेत्सुदुराचारो भजते मामनन्यभाक्। साधुरेव स मन्तव्यः सम्यग्व्यवसितो हि सः॥
verses.transliteration: api cet su-durācāro bhajate mām ananya-bhāk | sādhur eva sa mantavyaḥ samyag vyavasito hi saḥ ||
verses.translation: Nay, if one of evil life turn in his thought straightway to Me, count him amidst the good; he hath the high way chosen; he shall grow righteous ere long; he shall attain that peace which changes not. Thou Prince of India! be certain none can perish, trusting Me!
verses.teaching: Even if a person of extremely evil conduct worships Me with undivided devotion, that person should be considered righteous, for they have rightly resolved. Sincere devotion transforms even the worst sinner.

verses.sanskrit: क्षिप्रं भवति धर्मात्मा शश्वच्छान्तिं निगच्छति। कौन्तेय प्रतिजानीहि न मे भक्तः प्रणश्यति॥
verses.transliteration: kṣipraṁ bhavati dharmātmā śaśvac-chāntiṁ nigacchati | kaunteya pratijānīhi na me bhaktaḥ praṇaśyati ||
verses.translation: Nay, if one of evil life turn in his thought straightway to Me, count him amidst the good; he hath the high way chosen; he shall grow righteous ere long; he shall attain that peace which changes not. Thou Prince of India! be certain none can perish, trusting Me!
verses.teaching: Quickly that person becomes righteous and attains eternal peace. O son of Kunti, proclaim it boldly that My devotee never perishes. The Divine protects all sincere devotees.

verses.sanskrit: मां हि पार्थ व्यपाश्रित्य येऽपि स्युः पापयोनयः। स्त्रियो वैश्यास्तथा शूद्रास्तेऽपि यान्ति परां गतिम्॥
verses.transliteration: māṁ hi pārtha vyapāśritya ye 'pi syuḥ pāpa-yonayaḥ | striyo vaiśyās tathā śūdrās te 'pi yānti parāṁ gatim ||
verses.translation: O Pritha's Son! whoso will turn to Me, though such be of the womb of Shame, or lowly born,—women, Vaisyas, Sudras, all reach the highest way!
verses.teaching: For taking refuge in Me, O Partha, even those of sinful birth—women, merchants, and laborers—also attain the supreme goal. The Divine path is open to all regardless of birth or status.

verses.sanskrit: किं पुनर्ब्राह्मणाः पुण्या भक्ता राजर्षयस्तथा। अनित्यमसुखं लोकमिमं प्राप्य भजस्व माम्॥
verses.transliteration: kiṁ punar brāhmaṇāḥ puṇyā bhaktā rājarṣayas tathā | anityam asukhaṁ lokam imaṁ prāpya bhajasva mām ||
verses.translation: How much more, then, the holy Brahmans and My Royal Saints! Ah! ye who into this ill world are come, fleeting and full of pain! set your faith fast on Me!
verses.teaching: How much more then, the holy Brahmins and devoted royal sages! Having obtained this impermanent, joyless world, worship Me. If even the lowly can attain, how much more the spiritually inclined.

verses.sanskrit: मन्मना भव मद्भक्तो मद्याजी मां नमस्कुरु। मामेवैष्यसि युक्त्वैवमात्मानं मत्परायणः॥
verses.transliteration: man-manā bhava mad-bhakto mad-yājī māṁ namaskuru | mām evaiṣyasi yuktvaivm ātmānaṁ mat-parāyaṇaḥ ||
verses.translation: Fix heart and thought on Me! Adore Me! Bring offerings to Me! Make Me prostrations! Make Me your supremest joy! and, undivided thus, you shall come unto Me!
verses.teaching: Fix your mind on Me, be devoted to Me, sacrifice to Me, bow down to Me. Thus uniting yourself with Me as your highest goal, you shall come to Me. Complete surrender leads to union with the Divine.

verses.sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच भूय एव महाबाहो शृणु मे परमं वचः। यत्तेऽहं प्रीयमाणाय वक्ष्यामि हितकाम्यया॥
verses.transliteration: śrī-bhagavān uvāca bhūya eva mahā-bāho śṛṇu me paramaṁ vacaḥ | yat te 'haṁ prīyamāṇāya vakṣyāmi hita-kāmyayā ||
verses.translation: Yet hear again! My deeper word, I speak for love of thee! Thou lovest Me! Take to thy heart what I shall say—thy welfare is My will.
verses.teaching: The Supreme Lord said: Again, O mighty-armed, hear My supreme word, which I shall speak to you who are beloved, desiring your welfare.

verses.sanskrit: न मे विदुः सुरगणाः प्रभवं न महर्षयः। अहमादिर्हि देवानां महर्षीणां च सर्वशः॥
verses.transliteration: na me viduḥ sura-gaṇāḥ prabhavaṁ na maharṣayaḥ | aham ādir hi devānāṁ maharṣīṇāṁ ca sarvaśaḥ ||
verses.translation: The very gods know not the way of My beginning; nor the great Rishis, whom I made before they came to be!
verses.teaching: Neither the hosts of gods nor the great sages know My origin, for in every way I am the source of the gods and great sages.

verses.sanskrit: यो मामजमनादिं च वेत्ति लोकमहेश्वरम्। असम्मूढः स मर्त्येषु सर्वपापैः प्रमुच्यते॥
verses.transliteration: yo mām ajam anādiṁ ca vetti loka-maheśvaram | asammūḍhaḥ sa martyeṣu sarva-pāpaiḥ pramucyate ||
verses.translation: He that shall know Me birthless and unbegun, Lord of the Worlds, he—among mortal men—wanders not mazed, delivered from all sins.
verses.teaching: One who knows Me as unborn, beginningless, and the great Lord of the worlds—undeluded among mortals, that person is freed from all sins.

verses.sanskrit: बुद्धिर्ज्ञानमसम्मोहः क्षमा सत्यं दमः शमः। सुखं दुःखं भवोऽभावो भयं चाभयमेव च॥
verses.transliteration: buddhir jñānam asammohaḥ kṣamā satyaṁ damaḥ śamaḥ | sukhaṁ duḥkhaṁ bhavo 'bhāvo bhayaṁ cābhayam eva ca ||
verses.translation: Mind, understanding, truth, forbearance, self-control, quietude of spirit, pain and pleasure, being, and unbeing, fear and fearlessness,
verses.teaching: Intelligence, knowledge, non-delusion, forgiveness, truthfulness, self-restraint, tranquility, pleasure, pain, birth, death, fear, and fearlessness—

verses.sanskrit: अहिंसा समता तुष्टिस्तपो दानं यशोऽयशः। भवन्ति भावा भूतानां मत्त एव पृथग्विधाः॥
verses.transliteration: ahiṁsā samatā tuṣṭis tapo dānaṁ yaśo 'yaśaḥ | bhavanti bhāvā bhūtānāṁ matta eva pṛthag-vidhāḥ ||
verses.translation: Contentment, patient fortitude, the wise restraints of holiness, alms, honour, and dishonour—yea! all spring from Me!
verses.teaching: Non-violence, equanimity, contentment, austerity, charity, fame, and infamy—these various states of beings arise from Me alone.

verses.sanskrit: महर्षयः सप्त पूर्वे चत्वारो मनवस्तथा। मद्भावा मानसा जाता येषां लोक इमाः प्रजाः॥
verses.transliteration: maharṣayaḥ sapta pūrve catvāro manavas tathā | mad-bhāvā mānasā jātā yeṣāṁ loka imāḥ prajāḥ ||
verses.translation: The Seven Great Rishis and the Manus Four Sprang from my mind, engendered of my will; whose offspring fill the world.
verses.teaching: The seven great sages and the four ancient Manus, born from My mind, possessed of My nature, from whom these beings in the world have descended.

verses.sanskrit: एतां विभूतिं योगं च मम यो वेत्ति तत्त्वतः। सोऽविकम्पेन योगेन युज्यते नात्र संशयः॥
verses.transliteration: etāṁ vibhūtiṁ yogaṁ ca mama yo vetti tattvataḥ | so 'vikampena yogena yujyate nātra saṁśayaḥ ||
verses.translation: He who shall truly comprehend these states and powers of Me becometh rapt in faultless faith—there is no doubt of it!
verses.teaching: One who knows in truth this glory and yoga of Mine becomes united with Me through unshakable yoga—of this there is no doubt.

verses.sanskrit: अहं सर्वस्य प्रभवो मत्तः सर्वं प्रवर्तते। इति मत्वा भजन्ते मां बुधा भावसमन्विताः॥
verses.transliteration: ahaṁ sarvasya prabhavo mattaḥ sarvaṁ pravartate | iti matvā bhajante māṁ budhā bhāva-samanvitāḥ ||
verses.translation: I am the source of all; from Me all things proceed! Knowing Me thus, the wise with hearts of love adore.
verses.teaching: I am the source of all; from Me everything proceeds. Understanding thus, the wise worship Me with devotion-filled emotion.

verses.sanskrit: मच्चित्ता मद्गतप्राणा बोधयन्तः परस्परम्। कथयन्तश्च मां नित्यं तुष्यन्ति च रमन्ति च॥
verses.transliteration: mac-cittā mad-gata-prāṇā bodhayantaḥ parasparam | kathayantaś ca māṁ nityaṁ tuṣyanti ca ramanti ca ||
verses.translation: They keep their hearts and hopes on Me; their lives are in Me given; they enlighten and converse each with each, and ever they content them.
verses.teaching: With minds absorbed in Me, with lives surrendered to Me, enlightening one another and always speaking of Me, they are satisfied and delighted.

verses.sanskrit: तेषां सततयुक्तानां भजतां प्रीतिपूर्वकम्। ददामि बुद्धियोगं तं येन मामुपयान्ति ते॥
verses.transliteration: teṣāṁ satata-yuktānāṁ bhajatāṁ prīti-pūrvakam | dadāmi buddhi-yogaṁ taṁ yena mām upayānti te ||
verses.translation: To these, so worship-rapt and duteous, I grant a mind of perfect mood, whereby they come to Me.
verses.teaching: To those constantly united, who worship with love, I give the yoga of intelligence by which they come to Me.

verses.sanskrit: तेषामेवानुकम्पार्थमहमज्ञानजं तमः। नाशयाम्यात्मभावस्थो ज्ञानदीपेन भास्वता॥
verses.transliteration: teṣām evānukampārtham aham ajñāna-jaṁ tamaḥ | nāśayāmy ātma-bhāva-stho jñāna-dīpena bhāsvatā ||
verses.translation: To them, by pity moved, inhabiting their hearts, I make a light of wisdom shine, whereby the darkness born of ignorance is chased.
verses.teaching: Out of compassion for them, dwelling in their hearts, I destroy the darkness born of ignorance with the shining lamp of knowledge.

verses.sanskrit: अर्जुन उवाच परं ब्रह्म परं धाम पवित्रं परमं भवान्। पुरुषं शाश्वतं दिव्यमादिदेवमजं विभुम्॥
verses.transliteration: arjuna uvāca paraṁ brahma paraṁ dhāma pavitraṁ paramaṁ bhavān | puruṣaṁ śāśvataṁ divyam ādi-devam ajaṁ vibhum ||
verses.translation: Arjuna spake: Yea! Thou art PARABRAHM! The High Abode! The Great Purification! Thou art GOD Eternal, All-creating, Holy, First, Without beginning! Lord of Lords and Gods!
verses.teaching: Arjuna said: You are the Supreme Brahman, the supreme abode, the supreme purifier, the eternal Divine Person, the primal God, unborn and omnipresent.

verses.sanskrit: आहुस्त्वामृषयः सर्वे देवर्षिर्नारदस्तथा। असितो देवलो व्यासः स्वयं चैव ब्रवीषि मे॥
verses.transliteration: āhus tvām ṛṣayaḥ sarve devarṣir nāradas tathā | asito devalo vyāsaḥ svayaṁ caiva bravīṣi me ||
verses.translation: Declared of Thee are all the Rishis, Narada, Asita, Devala, Vyasa; and Thou Thyself dost say it!
verses.teaching: All the sages declare this of You—the divine sage Narada, as well as Asita, Devala, and Vyasa; and now You Yourself tell me so.

verses.sanskrit: सर्वमेतदृतं मन्ये यन्मां वदसि केशव। न हि ते भगवन्व्यक्तिं विदुर्देवा न दानवाः॥
verses.transliteration: sarvam etad ṛtaṁ manye yan māṁ vadasi keśava | na hi te bhagavan vyaktiṁ vidur devā na dānavāḥ ||
verses.translation: All this, O Kesava! I hold as true which Thou declarest! Lord! I do not know the coming or the going of Thy Form, nor do the gods, nor demons!
verses.teaching: I accept as truth all that You tell me, O Keshava. Neither the gods nor the demons, O Lord, know Your manifestation.

verses.sanskrit: स्वयमेवात्मनात्मानं वेत्थ त्वं पुरुषोत्तम। भूतभावन भूतेश देवदेव जगत्पते॥
verses.transliteration: svayam evātmanātmānaṁ vettha tvaṁ puruṣottama | bhūta-bhāvana bhūteśa deva-deva jagat-pate ||
verses.translation: Thyself alone Thou know'st, O Thou Supremest! Maker and Master of Thy creatures! God of Gods, and Lord of all the world!
verses.teaching: You alone know Yourself by Yourself, O Supreme Person, O source of beings, O Lord of beings, O God of gods, O Lord of the universe.

verses.sanskrit: वक्तुमर्हस्यशेषेण दिव्या ह्यात्मविभूतयः। याभिर्विभूतिभिर्लोकानिमांस्त्वं व्याप्य तिष्ठसि॥
verses.transliteration: vaktum arhasy aśeṣeṇa divyā hy ātma-vibhūtayaḥ | yābhir vibhūtibhir lokān imāṁs tvaṁ vyāpya tiṣṭhasi ||
verses.translation: Therefore, I pray Thee, tell me of Thy heavenly powers! declare how Thou abidest, O Divinest! in what form Thou pervadest all the world!
verses.teaching: You should indeed describe without omission Your divine glories, by which glories You pervade and remain in these worlds.

verses.sanskrit: कथं विद्यामहं योगिंस्त्वां सदा परिचिन्तयन्। केषु केषु च भावेषु चिन्त्योऽसि भगवन्मया॥
verses.transliteration: kathaṁ vidyām ahaṁ yogiṁs tvāṁ sadā paricintayan | keṣu keṣu ca bhāveṣu cintyo 'si bhagavan mayā ||
verses.translation: How shall I learn, Maker Supreme! to know Thee, though I muse on Thee continually? Under what form of Thine unnumbered forms art Thou to be discerned?
verses.teaching: How may I know You, O Yogi, by constant meditation? In what various aspects should You be thought of by me, O Lord?

verses.sanskrit: विस्तरेणात्मनो योगं विभूतिं च जनार्दन। भूयः कथय तृप्तिर्हि शृण्वतो नास्ति मेऽमृतम्॥
verses.transliteration: vistareṇātmano yogaṁ vibhūtiṁ ca janārdana | bhūyaḥ kathaya tṛptir hi śṛṇvato nāsti me 'mṛtam ||
verses.translation: Tell me once more, I pray, of those Thy powers and of Thy glories; I am not sated hearing of Thy greatness!
verses.teaching: Describe again in detail Your yoga and glory, O Janardana, for I am not satiated hearing Your immortal words.
