verses.sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच हन्त ते कथयिष्यामि दिव्या ह्यात्मविभूतयः। प्राधान्यतः कुरुश्रेष्ठ नास्त्यन्तो विस्तरस्य मे॥
verses.transliteration: śrī-bhagavān uvāca hanta te kathayiṣyāmi divyā hy ātma-vibhūtayaḥ | prādhānyataḥ kuru-śreṣṭha nāsty anto vistarasya me ||
verses.translation: Krishna. Yes! I will tell thee now—dear Prince! of My divine dimensions; but, in brief! for there is no end in numbering My infinitudes.
verses.teaching: The Supreme Lord said: Yes, I will declare to you My divine glories, but only the principal ones, O best of Kurus, for there is no end to My extent.

verses.sanskrit: अहमात्मा गुडाकेश सर्वभूताशयस्थितः। अहमादिश्च मध्यं च भूतानामन्त एव च॥
verses.transliteration: aham ātmā guḍākeśa sarva-bhūtāśaya-sthitaḥ | aham ādiś ca madhyaṁ ca bhūtānām anta eva ca ||
verses.translation: I am the Spirit seated deep in every creature's heart; from Me they come; by Me they live; at My word they end.
verses.teaching: I am the Self, O Gudakesha, seated in the hearts of all beings. I am the beginning, the middle, and also the end of all beings.

verses.sanskrit: आदित्यानामहं विष्णुर्ज्योतिषां रविरंशुमान्। मरीचिर्मरुतामस्मि नक्षत्राणामहं शशी॥
verses.transliteration: ādityānām ahaṁ viṣṇur jyotiṣāṁ ravir aṁśumān | marīcir marutām asmi nakṣatrāṇām ahaṁ śaśī ||
verses.translation: Of all the Adityas I am Vishnu; of all the lights I am the Sun; of Maruts I am Marichi; of stars I am the Moon.
verses.teaching: Of the Adityas I am Vishnu; among lights I am the radiant sun; I am Marichi among the Maruts; among stars I am the moon.

verses.sanskrit: वेदानां सामवेदोऽस्मि देवानामस्मि वासवः। इन्द्रियाणां मनश्चास्मि भूतानामस्मि चेतना॥
verses.transliteration: vedānāṁ sāma-vedo 'smi devānām asmi vāsavaḥ | indriyāṇāṁ manaś cāsmi bhūtānām asmi cetanā ||
verses.translation: Of Vedas I am Sama-Ved; of the gods I am Indra; of the senses I am mind, of living things I am the consciousness.
verses.teaching: Of the Vedas I am the Sama Veda; among the gods I am Indra; of the senses I am the mind; and in living beings I am consciousness.

verses.sanskrit: रुद्राणां शङ्करश्चास्मि वित्तेशो यक्षरक्षसाम्। वसूनां पावकश्चास्मि मेरुः शिखरिणामहम्॥
verses.transliteration: rudrāṇāṁ śaṅkaraś cāsmi vitteśo yakṣa-rakṣasām | vasūnāṁ pāvakaś cāsmi meruḥ śikhariṇām aham ||
verses.translation: I am Shiva, of all the Rudras; I am Vittesh, of Yakshas and Rakshasas; I am Pavaka, of the Vasus; I am Meru, of all the peaked mountains.
verses.teaching: Among the Rudras I am Shankara; among the Yakshas and Rakshasas I am the lord of wealth; among the Vasus I am fire; and among mountains I am Meru.

verses.sanskrit: पुरोधसां च मुख्यं मां विद्धि पार्थ बृहस्पतिम्। सेनानीनामहं स्कन्दः सरसामस्मि सागरः॥
verses.transliteration: purodhasāṁ ca mukhyaṁ māṁ viddhi pārtha bṛhaspatim | senānīnām ahaṁ skandaḥ sarasām asmi sāgaraḥ ||
verses.translation: And of the chief priests, Prince! know Me Brihaspati; of warrior-chiefs I am Skanda; of all the waters I am the Sea.
verses.teaching: Among priests, O Partha, know Me to be the chief, Brihaspati; of generals I am Skanda; of bodies of water I am the ocean.

verses.sanskrit: महर्षीणां भृगुरहं गिरामस्म्येकमक्षरम्। यज्ञानां जपयज्ञोऽस्मि स्थावराणां हिमालयः॥
verses.transliteration: maharṣīṇāṁ bhṛgur ahaṁ girām asmy ekam akṣaram | yajñānāṁ japa-yajño 'smi sthāvarāṇāṁ himālayaḥ ||
verses.translation: Of Maharishis I am Bhrigu; of uttered sounds the syllable OM; of prayers the prayer of praise; of things that move not I am Himalaya.
verses.teaching: Among the great sages I am Bhrigu; of utterances I am the single syllable Om; of sacrifices I am the sacrifice of silent repetition; among immovable things I am the Himalayas.

verses.sanskrit: अश्वत्थः सर्ववृक्षाणां देवर्षीणां च नारदः। गन्धर्वाणां चित्ररथः सिद्धानां कपिलो मुनिः॥
verses.transliteration: aśvatthaḥ sarva-vṛkṣāṇāṁ devarṣīṇāṁ ca nāradaḥ | gandharvāṇāṁ citrarathaḥ siddhānāṁ kapilo muniḥ ||
verses.translation: Of all the trees I am the Aswatha, of the Devarshis Narada; I am Chitraratha among the singers; I am Kapila among the saints.
verses.teaching: Among all trees I am the sacred fig tree; among divine sages, Narada; among the Gandharvas I am Chitraratha; among the perfected I am the sage Kapila.

verses.sanskrit: उच्चैःश्रवसमश्वानां विद्धि माममृतोद्भवम्। ऐरावतं गजेन्द्राणां नराणां च नराधिपम्॥
verses.transliteration: uccaiḥśravasam aśvānāṁ viddhi mām amṛtodbhavam | airāvataṁ gajendrāṇāṁ narāṇāṁ ca narādhipam ||
verses.translation: Among the horses know Me Uchchaisravas, born amid the battle of gods and demons for the Amrit; among the elephants I am Airavata; among men I am the King of men.
verses.teaching: Among horses, know Me as Uchchaihshravas, born of nectar; among lordly elephants, Airavata; and among men, the monarch.

verses.sanskrit: आयुधानामहं वज्रं धेनूनामस्मि कामधुक्। प्रजनश्चास्मि कन्दर्पः सर्पाणामस्मि वासुकिः॥
verses.transliteration: āyudhānām ahaṁ vajraṁ dhenūnām asmi kāmadhuk | prajanaś cāsmi kandarpaḥ sarpāṇām asmi vāsukiḥ ||
verses.translation: Of weapons I am the thunderbolt; of cows the milk-cow Kamadhuk; I am Kandarpa the love-god; of all the serpents I am Vasuki.
verses.teaching: Among weapons I am the thunderbolt; among cows I am the wish-fulfilling cow; I am Kandarpa, the cause of procreation; among serpents I am Vasuki.

verses.sanskrit: अनन्तश्चास्मि नागानां वरुणो यादसामहम्। पितॄणामर्यमा चास्मि यमः संयमतामहम्॥
verses.transliteration: anantaś cāsmi nāgānāṁ varuṇo yādasām aham | pitṝṇām aryamā cāsmi yamaḥ saṁyamatām aham ||
verses.translation: I am Ananta, of all the Nagas; of those that dwell in the sea I am Varuna; of the Pitris I am Aryaman; among those that bind and judge I am Yama.
verses.teaching: Among the Nagas I am Ananta; among water deities I am Varuna; among the ancestors I am Aryama; and among controllers I am Yama.

verses.sanskrit: प्रह्लादश्चास्मि दैत्यानां कालः कलयतामहम्। मृगाणां च मृगेन्द्रोऽहं वैनतेयश्च पक्षिणाम्॥
verses.transliteration: prahlādaś cāsmi daityānāṁ kālaḥ kalayatām aham | mṛgāṇāṁ ca mṛgendro 'haṁ vainateyaś ca pakṣiṇām ||
verses.translation: I am Prahlad, of the Daitya kings; of those that reckon I am Time; among the beasts I am the lion; among the birds I am Vinata's son.
verses.teaching: Among the Daityas I am Prahlada; among calculators I am time; among beasts I am the lion; and among birds I am Garuda, son of Vinata.

verses.sanskrit: पवनः पवतामस्मि रामः शस्त्रभृतामहम्। झषाणां मकरश्चास्मि स्रोतसामस्मि जाह्नवी॥
verses.transliteration: pavanaḥ pavatām asmi rāmaḥ śastra-bhṛtām aham | jhaṣāṇāṁ makaraś cāsmi srotasām asmi jāhnavī ||
verses.translation: Of purifiers I am the wind; of the wielders of weapons I am Rama; of all the fishes I am Makara; of all the rivers I am Jahnavi.
verses.teaching: Among purifiers I am the wind; among weapon-bearers I am Rama; among fishes I am the shark; and among rivers I am the Ganges.

verses.sanskrit: सर्गाणामादिरन्तश्च मध्यं चैवाहमर्जुन। अध्यात्मविद्या विद्यानां वादः प्रवदतामहम्॥
verses.transliteration: sargāṇām ādir antaś ca madhyaṁ caivāham arjuna | adhyātma-vidyā vidyānāṁ vādaḥ pravadatām aham ||
verses.translation: Of all creations, Arjuna! I am the beginning and the end and the middle. I am the Soul-knowledge among sciences; I am the argument of those who speak.
verses.teaching: Of creations I am the beginning, the end, and also the middle, O Arjuna. Among sciences I am the science of the Self; among debaters I am the logical conclusion.

verses.sanskrit: अक्षराणामकारोऽस्मि द्वन्द्वः सामासिकस्य च। अहमेवाक्षयः कालो धाताहं विश्वतोमुखः॥
verses.transliteration: akṣarāṇām a-kāro 'smi dvandvaḥ sāmāsikasya ca | aham evākṣayaḥ kālo dhātāhaṁ viśvato-mukhaḥ ||
verses.translation: Of letters I am the letter A; of two-fold word-forms I am the copulative; I am Time inexhaustible; I am the Sustainer, everywhere-facing.
verses.teaching: Among letters I am the letter A; among compounds I am the dual compound; I am indeed imperishable time; I am the sustainer, facing in all directions.

verses.sanskrit: मृत्युः सर्वहरश्चाहमुद्भवश्च भविष्यताम्। कीर्तिः श्रीर्वाक्च नारीणां स्मृतिर्मेधा धृतिः क्षमा॥
verses.transliteration: mṛtyuḥ sarva-haraś cāham udbhavaś ca bhaviṣyatām | kīrtiḥ śrīr vāk ca nārīṇāṁ smṛtir medhā dhṛtiḥ kṣamā ||
verses.translation: I am Death that snatches all away; I am the Source of things to be; I am the Feminine, of every quality—Fame, Fortune, Speech, Memory, Intelligence, Firmness, Patience.
verses.teaching: I am all-destroying death and the origin of things yet to be. Among feminine qualities I am fame, prosperity, speech, memory, intelligence, steadfastness, and forgiveness.

verses.sanskrit: बृहत्साम तथा साम्नां गायत्री छन्दसामहम्। मासानां मार्गशीर्षोऽहमृतूनां कुसुमाकरः॥
verses.transliteration: bṛhat-sāma tathā sāmnāṁ gāyatrī chandasām aham | māsānāṁ mārga-śīrṣo 'ham ṛtūnāṁ kusumākaraḥ ||
verses.translation: Of hymns I am the Brihatsaman; of metres I am Gayatri; of the twelve months I am Margasirsha; of the seasons I am the season of flowers.
verses.teaching: Among the Sama hymns I am the Brihatsaman; among meters I am the Gayatri; among months I am Margashirsha; among seasons I am spring.

verses.sanskrit: द्यूतं छलयतामस्मि तेजस्तेजस्विनामहम्। जयोऽस्मि व्यवसायोऽस्मि सत्त्वं सत्त्ववतामहम्॥
verses.transliteration: dyūtaṁ chalayatām asmi tejas tejasvinām aham | jayo 'smi vyavasāyo 'smi sattvaṁ sattvavatām aham ||
verses.translation: I am the gambling of the cheat; I am the splendour of the splendid things; I am Victory; I am Effort; I am the essence of the Qualities.
verses.teaching: Among deceivers I am the gambling game; I am the splendor of the splendid; I am victory, I am determination, I am the goodness of the good.

verses.sanskrit: वृष्णीनां वासुदेवोऽस्मि पाण्डवानां धनञ्जयः। मुनीनामप्यहं व्यासः कवीनामुशना कविः॥
verses.transliteration: vṛṣṇīnāṁ vāsudevo 'smi pāṇḍavānāṁ dhanañjayaḥ | munīnām apy ahaṁ vyāsaḥ kavīnām uśanā kaviḥ ||
verses.translation: I am Vasudeva, of the Vrishni; of Pandu's sons I am Arjuna; among the Munis I am Vyasa; of the poets I am Usanas.
verses.teaching: Among the Vrishnis I am Vasudeva; among the Pandavas I am Arjuna; among sages I am Vyasa; among poets I am the poet Ushanas.

verses.sanskrit: दण्डो दमयतामस्मि नीतिरस्मि जिगीषताम्। मौनं चैवास्मि गुह्यानां ज्ञानं ज्ञानवतामहम्॥
verses.transliteration: daṇḍo damayatām asmi nītir asmi jigīṣatām | maunaṁ caivāsmi guhyānāṁ jñānaṁ jñānavatām aham ||
verses.translation: I am the Rod of those that chasten; I am the Polity of princes seeking victory; I am the Silence of things secret; I am the Knowledge of the knowers.
verses.teaching: Among controllers I am the scepter; among those seeking victory I am statesmanship; among secrets I am silence; and among the wise I am wisdom.

verses.sanskrit: यच्चापि सर्वभूतानां बीजं तदहमर्जुन। न तदस्ति विना यत्स्यान्मया भूतं चराचरम्॥
verses.transliteration: yac cāpi sarva-bhūtānāṁ bījaṁ tad aham arjuna | na tad asti vinā yat syān mayā bhūtaṁ carācaram ||
verses.translation: And, Arjuna! I am whatever is the Seed of all the growths of life; there is not any being, of the things which move and are unmoved, which can be without Me!
verses.teaching: And whatever is the seed of all beings, that am I, O Arjuna. There is no being, moving or unmoving, that can exist without Me.

verses.sanskrit: नान्तोऽस्ति मम दिव्यानां विभूतीनां परन्तप। एष तूद्देशतः प्रोक्तो विभूतेर्विस्तरो मया॥
verses.transliteration: nānto 'sti mama divyānāṁ vibhūtīnāṁ parantapa | eṣa tūddeśataḥ prokto vibhūter vistaro mayā ||
verses.translation: Nor is there end, O Prince of India! of My divine dimensions; this which I have spoken is by sample only!
verses.teaching: There is no end to My divine manifestations, O scorcher of foes. This is just a brief description of the extent of My glory.

verses.sanskrit: यद्यद्विभूतिमत्सत्त्वं श्रीमदूर्जितमेव वा। तत्तदेवावगच्छ त्वं मम तेजोंऽशसम्भवम्॥
verses.transliteration: yad yad vibhūtimat sattvaṁ śrīmad ūrjitam eva vā | tat tad evāvagaccha tvaṁ mama tejo 'ṁśa-sambhavam ||
verses.translation: Wheresoe'er is wondrous work, and majesty, and might, know surely that some ray shines forth from Me, of My great glory!
verses.teaching: Whatever being possesses glory, brilliance, or power, understand that to be born of a fragment of My splendor.

verses.sanskrit: अथवा बहुनैतेन किं ज्ञातेन तवार्जुन। विष्टभ्याहमिदं कृत्स्नमेकांशेन स्थितो जगत्॥
verses.transliteration: athavā bahunaitena kiṁ jñātena tavārjuna | viṣṭabhyāham idaṁ kṛtsnam ekāṁśena sthito jagat ||
verses.translation: Yet what needeth thee, Arjuna! so great a lore to learn? Enough to know, O Prince! I planted this whole Universe with one small part of Me, and stay unchanged!
verses.teaching: But what is the use to you of knowing all this in detail, O Arjuna? I support this entire universe with a single fragment of Myself and remain.

verses.sanskrit: अर्जुन उवाच मदनुग्रहाय परमं गुह्यमध्यात्मसंज्ञितम्। यत्त्वयोक्तं वचस्तेन मोहोऽयं विगतो मम॥
verses.transliteration: arjuna uvāca mad-anugrahāya paramaṁ guhyam adhyātma-saṁjñitam | yat tvayoktaṁ vacas tena moho 'yaṁ vigato mama ||
verses.translation: Arjuna spake: This, for my soul's peace, have I heard from Thee, The unmanifest mystery, the Truth supreme, of all which teacheth Thee!
verses.teaching: Arjuna said: By Your grace, the supreme secret concerning the Self that You have spoken has dispelled my delusion.

verses.sanskrit: भवाप्ययौ हि भूतानां श्रुतौ विस्तरशो मया। त्वत्तः कमलपत्राक्ष माहात्म्यमपि चाव्ययम्॥
verses.transliteration: bhavāpyayau hi bhūtānāṁ śrutau vistaraśo mayā | tvattaḥ kamala-patrākṣa māhātmyam api cāvyayam ||
verses.translation: So is it! as Thou sayest! now I know, O Lotus-eyed! the appearing and disappearing of all beings, and Thy splendour infinite!
verses.teaching: Indeed, I have heard from You in detail about the origin and dissolution of beings, O lotus-eyed one, and also Your inexhaustible glory.

verses.sanskrit: एवमेतद्यथात्थ त्वमात्मानं परमेश्वर। द्रष्टुमिच्छामि ते रूपमैश्वरं पुरुषोत्तम॥
verses.transliteration: evam etad yathāttha tvam ātmānaṁ parameśvara | draṣṭum icchāmi te rūpam aiśvaraṁ puruṣottama ||
verses.translation: And now, O Lord of Lords! reveal Thyself, that I may see Thy very Self, Purushottama!
verses.teaching: It is as You have described Yourself, O Supreme Lord. I desire to see Your divine form, O Supreme Person.

verses.sanskrit: मन्यसे यदि तच्छक्यं मया द्रष्टुमिति प्रभो। योगेश्वर ततो मे त्वं दर्शयात्मानमव्ययम्॥
verses.transliteration: manyase yadi tac chakyaṁ mayā draṣṭum iti prabho | yogeśvara tato me tvaṁ darśayātmānam avyayam ||
verses.translation: Show me—O King!—if I may bear the sight, Thy very self, the Eternal Lord of Lords!
verses.teaching: If You think it possible for me to see this, O Lord, then O Master of Yoga, show me Your imperishable Self.

verses.sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच पश्य मे पार्थ रूपाणि शतशोऽथ सहस्रशः। नानाविधानि दिव्यानि नानावर्णाकृतीनि च॥
verses.transliteration: śrī-bhagavān uvāca paśya me pārtha rūpāṇi śataśo 'tha sahasraśaḥ | nānā-vidhāni divyāni nānā-varṇākṛtīni ca ||
verses.translation: Krishna. Behold! thou, Son of Pritha! now this My hundred thousand thousand shapes, strange, manifold, divine, of every hue and form.
verses.teaching: The Supreme Lord said: Behold, O Partha, My forms by the hundreds and thousands, of various kinds, divine, and of various colors and shapes.

verses.sanskrit: पश्यादित्यान्वसून्रुद्रानश्विनौ मरुतस्तथा। बहून्यदृष्टपूर्वाणि पश्याश्चर्याणि भारत॥
verses.transliteration: paśyādityān vasūn rudrān aśvinau marutas tathā | bahūny adṛṣṭa-pūrvāṇi paśyāścaryāṇi bhārata ||
verses.translation: Behold the Adityas, and the Vasus, and the Rudras, the Aswins, and Maruts; behold many marvels never yet beheld, O Bharata!
verses.teaching: Behold the Adityas, the Vasus, the Rudras, the two Ashvins, and the Maruts; behold many wonders never seen before, O descendant of Bharata.

verses.sanskrit: इहैकस्थं जगत्कृत्स्नं पश्याद्य सचराचरम्। मम देहे गुडाकेश यच्चान्यद्द्रष्टुमिच्छसि॥
verses.transliteration: ihaika-sthaṁ jagat kṛtsnaṁ paśyādya sa-carācaram | mama dehe guḍākeśa yac cānyad draṣṭum icchasi ||
verses.translation: Behold! in this My Body, Son of Pandu! see whatever thou hast wished to see; yea! on one spot all things that are—living and lifeless, and whate'er beside thou wiltest to behold.
verses.teaching: Here, unified in one place in My body, behold today the entire universe with all its moving and unmoving beings, O Gudakesha, and whatever else you wish to see.

verses.sanskrit: न तु मां शक्यसे द्रष्टुमनेनैव स्वचक्षुषा। दिव्यं ददामि ते चक्षुः पश्य मे योगमैश्वरम्॥
verses.transliteration: na tu māṁ śakyase draṣṭum anenaiva sva-cakṣuṣā | divyaṁ dadāmi te cakṣuḥ paśya me yogam aiśvaram ||
verses.translation: Yet seeing thus, with human eyes, thou canst not bear the sight! Lo! I give thee sense divine! Behold My Mystic Majesty!
verses.teaching: But you cannot see Me with these eyes of yours; I give you divine sight. Behold My divine yoga.

verses.sanskrit: सञ्जय उवाच एवमुक्त्वा ततो राजन्महायोगेश्वरो हरिः। दर्शयामास पार्थाय परमं रूपमैश्वरम्॥
verses.transliteration: sañjaya uvāca evam uktvā tato rājan mahā-yogeśvaro hariḥ | darśayām āsa pārthāya paramaṁ rūpam aiśvaram ||
verses.translation: Sanjaya. Then, O King! the God, so saying, Stood, to Pritha's Son displaying All the splendour, wonder, dread Of His vast Almighty-head.
verses.teaching: Sanjaya said: Having spoken thus, O King, the great Lord of Yoga, Hari, showed to Partha His supreme divine form.

verses.sanskrit: अनेकवक्त्रनयनमनेकाद्भुतदर्शनम्। अनेकदिव्याभरणं दिव्यानेकोद्यतायुधम्॥
verses.transliteration: aneka-vaktra-nayanam anekādbhuta-darśanam | aneka-divyābharaṇaṁ divyānekodyatāyudham ||
verses.translation: Out of countless eyes beholding, Out of countless mouths commanding, Out of countless mystic centres Bearing unconceived splendours;
verses.teaching: With many mouths and eyes, with many wondrous sights, with many divine ornaments, with many divine weapons upraised.

verses.sanskrit: दिव्यमाल्याम्बरधरं दिव्यगन्धानुलेपनम्। सर्वाश्चर्यमयं देवमनन्तं विश्वतोमुखम्॥
verses.transliteration: divya-mālyāmbara-dharaṁ divya-gandhānulepanam | sarvāścarya-mayaṁ devam anantaṁ viśvato-mukham ||
verses.translation: Crowned with celestial blooms, and robed in garments glittering with gold, With heavenly gems, and heavenly signs, and heavenly weapons manifold:
verses.teaching: Wearing divine garlands and garments, anointed with divine fragrances, the God consisting of all wonders, infinite, facing in all directions.

verses.sanskrit: दिवि सूर्यसहस्रस्य भवेद्युगपदुत्थिता। यदि भाः सदृशी सा स्याद्भासस्तस्य महात्मनः॥
verses.transliteration: divi sūrya-sahasrasya bhaved yugapad utthitā | yadi bhāḥ sadṛśī sā syād bhāsas tasya mahātmanaḥ ||
verses.translation: Flames for the face, and, for the eye, Suns; and a Universe of starry frets.
verses.teaching: If the radiance of a thousand suns were to burst forth at once in the sky, that would be like the splendor of that Mighty Being.

verses.sanskrit: तत्रैकस्थं जगत्कृत्स्नं प्रविभक्तमनेकधा। अपश्यद्देवदेवस्य शरीरे पाण्डवस्तदा॥
verses.transliteration: tatraika-sthaṁ jagat kṛtsnaṁ pravibhaktam anekadhā | apaśyad deva-devasya śarīre pāṇḍavas tadā ||
verses.translation: Then the Son of Pandu saw within the form of God, stationed in His vast Body, the whole Universe in its multitudinous parts.
verses.teaching: There Pandava then saw the entire universe, with its manifold divisions, gathered as one in the body of the God of gods.

verses.sanskrit: ततः स विस्मयाविष्टो हृष्टरोमा धनञ्जयः। प्रणम्य शिरसा देवं कृताञ्जलिरभाषत॥
verses.transliteration: tataḥ sa vismayāviṣṭo hṛṣṭa-romā dhanañjayaḥ | praṇamya śirasā devaṁ kṛtāñjalir abhāṣata ||
verses.translation: That sight, so awful and so vast, with dread and wonder filled The heart of Arjuna; his hair uprose; he knelt, and bowed his head, And clasped his palms, and cried, and spake.
verses.teaching: Then, overcome with amazement, his hair standing on end, Dhananjaya bowed his head to the God, and with joined palms spoke.

verses.sanskrit: अर्जुन उवाच पश्यामि देवांस्तव देव देहे सर्वांस्तथा भूतविशेषसङ्घान्। ब्रह्माणमीशं कमलासनस्थमृषींश्च सर्वानुरगांश्च दिव्यान्॥
verses.transliteration: arjuna uvāca paśyāmi devāṁs tava deva dehe sarvāṁs tathā bhūta-viśeṣa-saṅghān | brahmāṇam īśaṁ kamalāsana-stham ṛṣīṁś ca sarvān uragāṁś ca divyān ||
verses.translation: Arjuna. Yea! I have seen! I see! Lord! in Thy Body All the Gods; all the hosts of various beings; Brahma, sitting lone upon the lotus-throne; All the Rishis and the serpents bright and shining.
verses.teaching: Arjuna said: I see all the gods in Your body, O God, and the various hosts of beings—Lord Brahma seated on the lotus, all the sages, and the divine serpents.

verses.sanskrit: अनेकबाहूदरवक्त्रनेत्रं पश्यामि त्वां सर्वतोऽनन्तरूपम्। नान्तं न मध्यं न पुनस्तवादिं पश्यामि विश्वेश्वर विश्वरूप॥
verses.transliteration: aneka-bāhūdara-vaktra-netraṁ paśyāmi tvāṁ sarvato 'nanta-rūpam | nāntaṁ na madhyaṁ na punas tavādiṁ paśyāmi viśveśvara viśva-rūpa ||
verses.translation: Vast, numberless, manifold, infinite, Thy forms are shown to me! Arms, bodies, mouths, and eyes; on every side—all around—without beginning and without end I behold Thee, O Lord of the Universe! Vishwarupa!
verses.teaching: I see You with infinite forms on every side, with many arms, bellies, faces, and eyes. I see neither Your end, nor middle, nor beginning, O Lord of the universe, O universal form.

verses.sanskrit: किरीटिनं गदिनं चक्रिणं च तेजोराशिं सर्वतो दीप्तिमन्तम्। पश्यामि त्वां दुर्निरीक्ष्यं समन्ताद्दीप्तानलार्कद्युतिमप्रमेयम्॥
verses.transliteration: kirīṭinaṁ gadinaṁ cakriṇaṁ ca tejo-rāśiṁ sarvato dīptimantam | paśyāmi tvāṁ durnirīkṣyaṁ samantād dīptānalārka-dyutim aprameyam ||
verses.translation: Crowned with the radiant diadem, bearing the club and disc, in majesty I see Thee in a mass of light on every side, difficult to behold, ablaze with the glory of burning fire and the sun, immeasurable!
verses.teaching: I see You with crown, mace, and disc—a mass of radiance shining everywhere, very hard to look at, blazing all around like burning fire and the sun, immeasurable.

verses.sanskrit: त्वमक्षरं परमं वेदितव्यं त्वमस्य विश्वस्य परं निधानम्। त्वमव्ययः शाश्वतधर्मगोप्ता सनातनस्त्वं पुरुषो मतो मे॥
verses.transliteration: tvam akṣaraṁ paramaṁ veditavyaṁ tvam asya viśvasya paraṁ nidhānam | tvam avyayaḥ śāśvata-dharma-goptā sanātanas tvaṁ puruṣo mato me ||
verses.translation: Thou art the Primal God, the Ancient Purusha, the Ultimate Refuge of this Universe! Thou art the Knower, the Known, and the Supreme Abode. O Thou of infinite forms, by Thee is the Universe pervaded!
verses.teaching: You are the imperishable, the supreme to be known; You are the ultimate resting place of this universe; You are the imperishable guardian of eternal dharma; You are the primeval Person—this is my conviction.

verses.sanskrit: अनादिमध्यान्तमनन्तवीर्यमनन्तबाहुं शशिसूर्यनेत्रम्। पश्यामि त्वां दीप्तहुताशवक्त्रं स्वतेजसा विश्वमिदं तपन्तम्॥
verses.transliteration: anādi-madhyāntam ananta-vīryam ananta-bāhuṁ śaśi-sūrya-netram | paśyāmi tvāṁ dīpta-hutāśa-vaktraṁ sva-tejasā viśvam idaṁ tapantam ||
verses.translation: Without beginning, middle, or end; infinite in power; with numberless arms; the sun and moon Thine eyes; Thy mouth a flaming fire; heating the Universe with Thy radiance!
verses.teaching: Without beginning, middle, or end, of infinite power, with infinite arms, with the moon and sun as eyes, I see You with a blazing fire for a mouth, heating this entire universe with Your radiance.

verses.sanskrit: द्यावापृथिव्योरिदमन्तरं हि व्याप्तं त्वयैकेन दिशश्च सर्वाः। दृष्ट्वाद्भुतं रूपमुग्रं तवेदं लोकत्रयं प्रव्यथितं महात्मन्॥
verses.transliteration: dyāv ā-pṛthivyor idam antaraṁ hi vyāptaṁ tvayaikena diśaś ca sarvāḥ | dṛṣṭvādbhutaṁ rūpam ugraṁ tavedaṁ loka-trayaṁ pravyathitaṁ mahātman ||
verses.translation: Yea! the space between Heaven and Earth is filled by Thee alone, and all the regions. O Thou Mighty One! when I behold this, Thy fearful, marvellous Form, the three worlds tremble!
verses.teaching: This space between heaven and earth is pervaded by You alone, and all directions. Seeing this wondrous and terrible form of Yours, the three worlds tremble, O great soul.

verses.sanskrit: अमी हि त्वां सुरसङ्घा विशन्ति केचिद्भीताः प्राञ्जलयो गृणन्ति। स्वस्तीत्युक्त्वा महर्षिसिद्धसङ्घाः स्तुवन्ति त्वां स्तुतिभिः पुष्कलाभिः॥
verses.transliteration: amī hi tvāṁ sura-saṅghā viśanti kecid bhītāḥ prāñjalayo gṛṇanti | svastīty uktvā maharṣi-siddha-saṅghāḥ stuvanti tvāṁ stutibhiḥ puṣkalābhiḥ ||
verses.translation: Yea! the Hosts of Heaven enter Thee! some, afraid, with folded hands Sing peace to Thee! others, in troops, sing hymns and call on Thee, by the companies of Saints and Sages crying, 'Hail! All hail!'
verses.teaching: These hosts of gods enter into You; some, in fear, praise You with joined palms. Multitudes of great sages and perfected beings cry 'Hail!' and praise You with abundant hymns.

verses.sanskrit: रुद्रादित्या वसवो ये च साध्या विश्वेऽश्विनौ मरुतश्चोष्मपाश्च। गन्धर्वयक्षासुरसिद्धसङ्घा वीक्षन्ते त्वां विस्मिताश्चैव सर्वे॥
verses.transliteration: rudrādityā vasavo ye ca sādhyā viśve 'śvinau marutaś coṣmapāś ca | gandharva-yakṣāsura-siddha-saṅghā vīkṣante tvāṁ vismitāś caiva sarve ||
verses.translation: Rudras, Adityas, Vasus, Sadhyas, Viswas, the Aswins, Maruts, and Ushmapas, and throngs of Gandharvas, Yakshas, Asuras, and Siddhas, all, amazed, behold Thee!
verses.teaching: The Rudras, Adityas, Vasus, Sadhyas, Vishvedevas, the two Ashvins, Maruts, and the spirits of ancestors, and the hosts of Gandharvas, Yakshas, Asuras, and Siddhas—all gaze at You in amazement.

verses.sanskrit: रूपं महत्ते बहुवक्त्रनेत्रं महाबाहो बहुबाहूरुपादम्। बहूदरं बहुदंष्ट्राकरालं दृष्ट्वा लोकाः प्रव्यथितास्तथाहम्॥
verses.transliteration: rūpaṁ mahat te bahu-vaktra-netraṁ mahā-bāho bahu-bāhūru-pādam | bahūdaraṁ bahu-daṁṣṭrā-karālaṁ dṛṣṭvā lokāḥ pravyathitās tathāham ||
verses.translation: Seeing Thy vast form, with its myriad mouths, eyes, arms, thighs, feet, bellies, and fearful with many tusks, all the worlds are frightened, as also am I.
verses.teaching: Seeing Your great form with many mouths and eyes, O mighty-armed one, with many arms, thighs, and feet, with many bellies, terrible with many tusks—the worlds tremble, and so do I.

verses.sanskrit: नभःस्पृशं दीप्तमनेकवर्णं व्यात्ताननं दीप्तविशालनेत्रम्। दृष्ट्वा हि त्वां प्रव्यथितान्तरात्मा धृतिं न विन्दामि शमं च विष्णो॥
verses.transliteration: nabhaḥ-spṛśaṁ dīptam aneka-varṇaṁ vyāttānanaṁ dīpta-viśāla-netram | dṛṣṭvā hi tvāṁ pravyathitāntarātmā dhṛtiṁ na vindāmi śamaṁ ca viṣṇo ||
verses.translation: Touching the sky, ablaze with many colors, with mouths wide open, with large blazing eyes—seeing Thee thus, my inmost soul trembles, and I find neither courage nor peace, O Vishnu!
verses.teaching: Seeing You touching the sky, blazing with many colors, with gaping mouths and large blazing eyes, my inner self trembles in fear, and I find neither courage nor peace, O Vishnu.

verses.sanskrit: दंष्ट्राकरालानि च ते मुखानि दृष्ट्वैव कालानलसन्निभानि। दिशो न जाने न लभे च शर्म प्रसीद देवेश जगन्निवास॥
verses.transliteration: daṁṣṭrā-karālāni ca te mukhāni dṛṣṭvaiva kālānala-sannibhāni | diśo na jāne na labhe ca śarma prasīda deveśa jagan-nivāsa ||
verses.translation: Seeing Thy mouths terrible with tusks, resembling the fire of dissolution, I know not the directions, nor do I find any refuge. Be gracious, O Lord of Gods, O Abode of the Universe!
verses.teaching: Seeing Your mouths terrible with tusks, like the fire of cosmic dissolution, I lose my sense of direction and find no comfort. Have mercy, O Lord of Gods, O refuge of the universe!

verses.sanskrit: अमी च त्वां धृतराष्ट्रस्य पुत्राः सर्वे सहैवावनिपालसङ्घैः। भीष्मो द्रोणः सूतपुत्रस्तथासौ सहास्मदीयैरपि योधमुख्यैः॥
verses.transliteration: amī ca tvāṁ dhṛtarāṣṭrasya putrāḥ sarve sahaivāvani-pāla-saṅghaiḥ | bhīṣmo droṇaḥ sūta-putras tathāsau sahāsmadīyair api yodha-mukhyaiḥ ||
verses.translation: Behold! the sons of Dhritarashtra! all these hosts of kings! Bhishma, Drona, and Karna, with the chiefs of our army also;
verses.teaching: All the sons of Dhritarashtra, along with hosts of kings, Bhishma, Drona, and the charioteer's son Karna, together with our chief warriors too—

verses.sanskrit: वक्त्राणि ते त्वरमाणा विशन्ति दंष्ट्राकरालानि भयानकानि। केचिद्विलग्ना दशनान्तरेषु सन्दृश्यन्ते चूर्णितैरुत्तमाङ्गैः॥
verses.transliteration: vaktrāṇi te tvaramāṇā viśanti daṁṣṭrā-karālāni bhayānakāni | kecid vilagnā daśanāntareṣu sandṛśyante cūrṇitair uttamāṅgaiḥ ||
verses.translation: They rush into Thy mouths, terrifying, ghastly-tusked. Some are seen caught between the teeth, with their heads crushed to powder.
verses.teaching: They rush swiftly into Your mouths, terrible with tusks and fearful to behold. Some are seen clinging between Your teeth, their heads crushed.

verses.sanskrit: यथा नदीनां बहवोऽम्बुवेगाः समुद्रमेवाभिमुखा द्रवन्ति। तथा तवामी नरलोकवीरा विशन्ति वक्त्राण्यभिविज्वलन्ति॥
verses.transliteration: yathā nadīnāṁ bahavo 'mbu-vegāḥ samudram evābhimukhā dravanti | tathā tavāmī nara-loka-vīrā viśanti vaktrāṇy abhivijvalanti ||
verses.translation: As many torrents of the rivers rush toward the ocean, so these heroes of the world of men rush into Thy flaming mouths.
verses.teaching: As many torrents of rivers flow toward the ocean, so these heroes of the world of men enter Your blazing mouths.

verses.sanskrit: यथा प्रदीप्तं ज्वलनं पतङ्गा विशन्ति नाशाय समृद्धवेगाः। तथैव नाशाय विशन्ति लोकास्तवापि वक्त्राणि समृद्धवेगाः॥
verses.transliteration: yathā pradīptaṁ jvalanaṁ pataṅgā viśanti nāśāya samṛddha-vegāḥ | tathaiva nāśāya viśanti lokās tavāpi vaktrāṇi samṛddha-vegāḥ ||
verses.translation: As moths rush with great speed into a blazing fire to their destruction, so also do these beings rush with great speed into Thy mouths to their destruction.
verses.teaching: As moths rush with full speed into a blazing fire to perish, so these worlds rush with full speed into Your mouths to their destruction.

verses.sanskrit: लेलिह्यसे ग्रसमानः समन्ताल्लोकान्समग्रान्वदनैर्ज्वलद्भिः। तेजोभिरापूर्य जगत्समग्रं भासस्तवोग्राः प्रतपन्ति विष्णो॥
verses.transliteration: lelihyase grasamānaḥ samantāl lokān samagrān vadanair jvaladbhiḥ | tejobhir āpūrya jagat samagraṁ bhāsas tavogrāḥ pratapanti viṣṇo ||
verses.translation: Thou lickest up mankind with Thy flaming jaws, devouring all the worlds on every side. Thy fiery rays fill the whole universe with radiance terrible, O Vishnu!
verses.teaching: You lick up all the worlds with Your flaming mouths, devouring them from all sides. Your fierce rays fill the entire universe with radiance and scorch it, O Vishnu.

verses.sanskrit: आख्याहि मे को भवानुग्ररूपो नमोऽस्तु ते देववर प्रसीद। विज्ञातुमिच्छामि भवन्तमाद्यं न हि प्रजानामि तव प्रवृत्तिम्॥
verses.transliteration: ākhyāhi me ko bhavān ugra-rūpo namo 'stu te deva-vara prasīda | vijñātum icchāmi bhavantam ādyaṁ na hi prajānāmi tava pravṛttim ||
verses.translation: Tell me who Thou art, so fierce of form! Salutations to Thee! O Thou Supreme God! Have mercy! I desire to know Thee, the Primal One, for I do not understand Thy action.
verses.teaching: Tell me who You are in this terrible form. Salutations to You, O best of gods; be gracious! I desire to know You, the primeval one, for I do not understand Your purpose.

verses.sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच कालोऽस्मि लोकक्षयकृत्प्रवृद्धो लोकान्समाहर्तुमिह प्रवृत्तः। ऋतेऽपि त्वां न भविष्यन्ति सर्वे येऽवस्थिताः प्रत्यनीकेषु योधाः॥
verses.transliteration: śrī-bhagavān uvāca kālo 'smi loka-kṣaya-kṛt pravṛddho lokān samāhartum iha pravṛttaḥ | ṛte 'pi tvāṁ na bhaviṣyanti sarve ye 'vasthitāḥ pratyanīkeṣu yodhāḥ ||
verses.translation: The Supreme Lord said: I am Time, the mighty world-destroyer! I come to destroy the worlds. Even without thee, none of the warriors standing in the opposing armies shall survive.
verses.teaching: The Supreme Lord said: I am Time, the great destroyer of worlds, engaged here in destroying the worlds. Even without you, all the warriors arrayed in opposing armies shall cease to exist.

verses.sanskrit: तस्मात्त्वमुत्तिष्ठ यशो लभस्व जित्वा शत्रून्भुङ्क्ष्व राज्यं समृद्धम्। मयैवैते निहताः पूर्वमेव निमित्तमात्रं भव सव्यसाचिन्॥
verses.transliteration: tasmāt tvam uttiṣṭha yaśo labhasva jitvā śatrūn bhuṅkṣva rājyaṁ samṛddham | mayaivaite nihatāḥ pūrvam eva nimitta-mātraṁ bhava savya-sācin ||
verses.translation: Therefore, arise! win glory! conquer thy foes, and enjoy a prosperous kingdom. They are already slain by Me. Be thou merely the instrument, O Arjuna!
verses.teaching: Therefore, arise and attain glory! Conquer your enemies and enjoy a prosperous kingdom. By Me alone they have already been slain; be merely an instrument, O Arjuna.

verses.sanskrit: द्रोणं च भीष्मं च जयद्रथं च कर्णं तथान्यानपि योधवीरान्। मया हतांस्त्वं जहि मा व्यथिष्ठा युध्यस्व जेतासि रणे सपत्नान्॥
verses.transliteration: droṇaṁ ca bhīṣmaṁ ca jayadrathaṁ ca karṇaṁ tathānyān api yodha-vīrān | mayā hatāṁs tvaṁ jahi mā vyathiṣṭhā yudhyasva jetāsi raṇe sapatnān ||
verses.translation: Drona, Bhishma, Jayadratha, Karna, and other brave warriors—these have already been slain by Me. Kill them without fear. Fight, and thou shalt conquer thy foes in battle!
verses.teaching: Drona, Bhishma, Jayadratha, Karna, and other warrior heroes too—already slain by Me, you kill them. Do not waver. Fight! You shall conquer your enemies in battle.

verses.sanskrit: सञ्जय उवाच एतच्छ्रुत्वा वचनं केशवस्य कृताञ्जलिर्वेपमानः किरीटी। नमस्कृत्वा भूय एवाह कृष्णं सगद्गदं भीतभीतः प्रणम्य॥
verses.transliteration: sañjaya uvāca etac chrutvā vacanaṁ keśavasya kṛtāñjalir vepamānaḥ kirīṭī | namaskṛtvā bhūya evāha kṛṣṇaṁ sa-gadgadaṁ bhīta-bhītaḥ praṇamya ||
verses.translation: Sanjaya said: Having heard these words of Krishna, the crowned one (Arjuna), trembling, with folded hands, prostrated himself and spoke to Krishna in a choked voice, bowing down, overwhelmed with fear.
verses.teaching: Sanjaya said: Having heard this speech of Keshava, Arjuna, trembling with joined palms, bowed down and again addressed Krishna in a faltering voice, prostrating with fear.

verses.sanskrit: अर्जुन उवाच स्थाने हृषीकेश तव प्रकीर्त्या जगत्प्रहृष्यत्यनुरज्यते च। रक्षांसि भीतानि दिशो द्रवन्ति सर्वे नमस्यन्ति च सिद्धसङ्घाः॥
verses.transliteration: arjuna uvāca sthāne hṛṣīkeśa tava prakīrtyā jagat prahṛṣyaty anurajyate ca | rakṣāṁsi bhītāni diśo dravanti sarve namasyanti ca siddha-saṅghāḥ ||
verses.translation: Arjuna said: Rightly, O Krishna! the world rejoices and is attracted by Thy praise. The demons flee in fear to all quarters, and the hosts of perfected beings bow to Thee.
verses.teaching: Arjuna said: It is fitting, O Hrishikesha, that the world delights and rejoices in Your praise. The demons flee in fear in all directions, and all the hosts of perfected beings bow to You.

verses.sanskrit: कस्माच्च ते न नमेरन्महात्मन् गरीयसे ब्रह्मणोऽप्यादिकर्त्रे। अनन्त देवेश जगन्निवास त्वमक्षरं सदसत्तत्परं यत्॥
verses.transliteration: kasmāc ca te na nameran mahātman garīyase brahmaṇo 'py ādi-kartre | ananta deveśa jagan-nivāsa tvam akṣaraṁ sad-asat tat-paraṁ yat ||
verses.translation: And why should they not bow to Thee, O Great Soul, greater even than Brahma, the Primal Creator? O Infinite One! O Lord of Gods! O Abode of the Universe! Thou art the Imperishable, the Being and the Non-being, and that which is beyond both.
verses.teaching: And why should they not bow to You, O great soul, greater than Brahma, the original creator? O Infinite, O Lord of Gods, O refuge of the universe, You are the imperishable, being and non-being, and that which is beyond both.

verses.sanskrit: त्वमादिदेवः पुरुषः पुराणस्त्वमस्य विश्वस्य परं निधानम्। वेत्तासि वेद्यं च परं च धाम त्वया ततं विश्वमनन्तरूप॥
verses.transliteration: tvam ādi-devaḥ puruṣaḥ purāṇas tvam asya viśvasya paraṁ nidhānam | vettāsi vedyaṁ ca paraṁ ca dhāma tvayā tataṁ viśvam ananta-rūpa ||
verses.translation: Thou art the Primal God, the Ancient Person; Thou art the ultimate refuge of this universe. Thou art the Knower, the Known, and the Supreme Abode. By Thee is the universe pervaded, O Thou of infinite forms!
verses.teaching: You are the primal God, the ancient Person; You are the supreme refuge of this universe. You are the knower and the knowable, and the supreme abode. By You the universe is pervaded, O infinite form.

verses.sanskrit: वायुर्यमोऽग्निर्वरुणः शशाङ्कः प्रजापतिस्त्वं प्रपितामहश्च। नमो नमस्तेऽस्तु सहस्रकृत्वः पुनश्च भूयोऽपि नमो नमस्ते॥
verses.transliteration: vāyur yamo 'gnir varuṇaḥ śaśāṅkaḥ prajāpatis tvaṁ prapitāmahaś ca | namo namas te 'stu sahasra-kṛtvaḥ punaś ca bhūyo 'pi namo namas te ||
verses.translation: Thou art Vayu, Yama, Agni, Varuna, the Moon, the Creator, and the Great-Grandfather. Salutations to Thee a thousand times, and again and yet again salutations to Thee!
verses.teaching: You are Vayu, Yama, Agni, Varuna, the moon, Prajapati, and the great-grandfather. Salutations, salutations to You a thousand times, and again and yet again, salutations to You!

verses.sanskrit: नमः पुरस्तादथ पृष्ठतस्ते नमोऽस्तु ते सर्वत एव सर्व। अनन्तवीर्यामितविक्रमस्त्वं सर्वं समाप्नोषि ततोऽसि सर्वः॥
verses.transliteration: namaḥ purastād atha pṛṣṭhatas te namo 'stu te sarvata eva sarva | ananta-vīryāmita-vikramas tvaṁ sarvaṁ samāpnoṣi tato 'si sarvaḥ ||
verses.translation: Salutations to Thee from before and from behind! Salutations to Thee from all sides, O Thou All! Of infinite power and immeasurable might, Thou pervadest all; therefore Thou art All!
verses.teaching: Salutations to You from the front and from behind, salutations to You from all sides, O All! Of infinite valor and boundless might, You pervade all; therefore You are all.

verses.sanskrit: सखेति मत्वा प्रसभं यदुक्तं हे कृष्ण हे यादव हे सखेति। अजानता महिमानं तवेदं मया प्रमादात्प्रणयेन वापि॥
verses.transliteration: sakheti matvā prasabhaṁ yad uktaṁ he kṛṣṇa he yādava he sakheti | ajānatā mahimānaṁ tavedaṁ mayā pramādāt praṇayena vāpi ||
verses.translation: And if, in hasty speech, I called Thee 'Krishna,' 'Yadava,' 'Friend,' not knowing this Thy splendour, heedlessly or in love, and if in jest I treated Thee too lightly;
verses.teaching: Whatever I have said impetuously, thinking You a friend—'O Krishna, O Yadava, O friend'—not knowing this greatness of Yours, through negligence or even through affection—

verses.sanskrit: यच्चावहासार्थमसत्कृतोऽसि विहारशय्यासनभोजनेषु। एकोऽथवाप्यच्युत तत्समक्षं तत्क्षामये त्वामहमप्रमेयम्॥
verses.transliteration: yac cāvahāsārtham asatkṛto 'si vihāra-śayyāsana-bhojaneṣu | eko 'thavāpy acyuta tat-samakṣaṁ tat kṣāmaye tvām aham aprameyam ||
verses.translation: Played, or reposed, or sat at ease with Thee, which—knowing not Thy Majesty—I did, then forgive me, Immeasurable Lord!
verses.teaching: And if in jest I have treated You disrespectfully during sport, rest, sitting, or eating, alone or in company, O unfallen one—for that I ask forgiveness of You, immeasurable one.

verses.sanskrit: पितासि लोकस्य चराचरस्य त्वमस्य पूज्यश्च गुरुर्गरीयान्। न त्वत्समोऽस्त्यभ्यधिकः कुतोऽन्यो लोकत्रयेऽप्यप्रतिमप्रभाव॥
verses.transliteration: pitāsi lokasya carācarasya tvam asya pūjyaś ca gurur garīyān | na tvat-samo 'sty abhyadhikaḥ kuto 'nyo loka-traye 'py apratima-prabhāva ||
verses.translation: Thou art the Father of all worlds, of all that moves and all that stands, of all which is! Worshipful art Thou, and worshipped; Guru of Gurus; greater than all great, there is not in the three worlds one equal to Thee!
verses.teaching: You are the father of this world of moving and unmoving beings; You are its revered teacher, most worthy of worship. There is none equal to You; how could there be anyone greater, O incomparable in power, in all three worlds?

verses.sanskrit: तस्मात्प्रणम्य प्रणिधाय कायं प्रसादये त्वामहमीशमीड्यम्। पितेव पुत्रस्य सखेव सख्युः प्रियः प्रियायार्हसि देव सोढुम्॥
verses.transliteration: tasmāt praṇamya praṇidhāya kāyaṁ prasādaye tvām aham īśam īḍyam | piteva putrasya sakheva sakhyuḥ priyaḥ priyāyārhasi deva soḍhum ||
verses.translation: Therefore I bow me down, and I entreat Thy mercy, Lord adorable and dear! As father to his son, as friend to friend, as one who loveth to his lover, turn Thy heart, O God! and be compassionate!
verses.teaching: Therefore, bowing down and prostrating my body, I seek grace from You, the praiseworthy Lord. As a father to a son, as a friend to a friend, as a beloved to a beloved, please bear with me, O God.

verses.sanskrit: अदृष्टपूर्वं हृषितोऽस्मि दृष्ट्वा भयेन च प्रव्यथितं मनो मे। तदेव मे दर्शय देव रूपं प्रसीद देवेश जगन्निवास॥
verses.transliteration: adṛṣṭa-pūrvaṁ hṛṣito 'smi dṛṣṭvā bhayena ca pravyathitaṁ mano me | tad eva me darśaya deva rūpaṁ prasīda deveśa jagan-nivāsa ||
verses.translation: Glad am I, seeing this which never eye saw yet, yet is my heart shaken with fear! Show me, O God! Thy other form again! Be merciful, Lord of Gods! Refuge of all the worlds!
verses.teaching: Having seen what has never been seen before, I am thrilled, yet my mind trembles with fear. Show me that very form, O God. Be gracious, O Lord of Gods, O abode of the universe.

verses.sanskrit: किरीटिनं गदिनं चक्रहस्तमिच्छामि त्वां द्रष्टुमहं तथैव। तेनैव रूपेण चतुर्भुजेन सहस्रबाहो भव विश्वमूर्ते॥
verses.transliteration: kirīṭinaṁ gadinaṁ cakra-hastam icchāmi tvāṁ draṣṭum ahaṁ tathaiva | tenaiva rūpeṇa catur-bhujena sahasra-bāho bhava viśva-mūrte ||
verses.translation: Fain would I see Thee as of yore, with disc and forehead-gem and sceptre, in Thy hands. Take Thou again Thy four-armed shape, O Thou of thousand arms! O Form Universal!
verses.teaching: I wish to see You as before, crowned, with mace and disc in hand. Please assume that same four-armed form, O thousand-armed one, O universal form.

verses.sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच मया प्रसन्नेन तवार्जुनेदं रूपं परं दर्शितमात्मयोगात्। तेजोमयं विश्वमनन्तमाद्यं यन्मे त्वदन्येन न दृष्टपूर्वम्॥
verses.transliteration: śrī-bhagavān uvāca mayā prasannena tavārjunedaṁ rūpaṁ paramaṁ darśitam ātma-yogāt | tejo-mayaṁ viśvam anantam ādyaṁ yan me tvad-anyena na dṛṣṭa-pūrvam ||
verses.translation: The Supreme Lord said: Yea! Prince! I show this Face to thee with favour, by My mystic power! Never was it seen of man, save only thee—this Form, which is My highest shape—vast, shining, manifold, infinite!
verses.teaching: The Supreme Lord said: Pleased with you, O Arjuna, I have shown you through My own yoga power this supreme form—luminous, universal, infinite, primordial—which none but you has seen before.

verses.sanskrit: न वेदयज्ञाध्ययनैर्न दानैर्न च क्रियाभिर्न तपोभिरुग्रैः। एवंरूपः शक्य अहं नृलोके द्रष्टुं त्वदन्येन कुरुप्रवीर॥
verses.transliteration: na veda-yajñādhyayanair na dānair na ca kriyābhir na tapobhir ugraiḥ | evaṁ-rūpaḥ śakya ahaṁ nṛ-loke draṣṭuṁ tvad anyena kuru-pravīra ||
verses.translation: Not by Vedas, nor from sacrifice, nor penance, nor gift of goods, nor works of righteousness, shall mortal men behold what thou hast seen, O Prince of India!
verses.teaching: Not by Vedas, sacrifices, study, gifts, rituals, or severe austerities can I be seen in this form in the world of humans by anyone other than you, O hero of the Kurus.

verses.sanskrit: मा ते व्यथा मा च विमूढभावो दृष्ट्वा रूपं घोरमीदृङ्ममेदम्। व्यपेतभीः प्रीतमनाः पुनस्त्वं तदेव मे रूपमिदं प्रपश्य॥
verses.transliteration: mā te vyathā mā ca vimūḍha-bhāvo dṛṣṭvā rūpaṁ ghoram īdṛṅ mamedam | vyapeta-bhīḥ prīta-manāḥ punas tvaṁ tad eva me rūpam idaṁ prapaśya ||
verses.translation: Let thy heart be untroubled, and thy mind unclouded, gazing thus on this Form terrible to view; be glad of heart; fear not, and once again behold Me as I was!
verses.teaching: Do not be troubled or bewildered seeing this terrible form of Mine. Free from fear and with a glad heart, now behold again that same form of Mine.

verses.sanskrit: सञ्जय उवाच इत्यर्जुनं वासुदेवस्तथोक्त्वा स्वकं रूपं दर्शयामास भूयः। आश्वासयामास च भीतमेनं भूत्वा पुनः सौम्यवपुर्महात्मा॥
verses.transliteration: sañjaya uvāca ity arjunaṁ vāsudevas tathoktvā svakaṁ rūpaṁ darśayām āsa bhūyaḥ | āśvāsayām āsa ca bhītam enaṁ bhūtvā punaḥ saumya-vapur mahātmā ||
verses.translation: Sanjaya said: These words to Arjuna spake Vasudeva, and straight therewith He showed again the form He first had worn. Once more the Mahatma, Prince! was manifest with peace-inspiring, tender, human cheeks.
verses.teaching: Sanjaya said: Having thus spoken to Arjuna, Vasudeva showed him His own form again. The great soul, assuming once more His gentle form, consoled the frightened one.

verses.sanskrit: अर्जुन उवाच दृष्ट्वेदं मानुषं रूपं तव सौम्यं जनार्दन। इदानीमस्मि संवृत्तः सचेताः प्रकृतिं गतः॥
verses.transliteration: arjuna uvāca dṛṣṭvedaṁ mānuṣaṁ rūpaṁ tava saumyaṁ janārdana | idānīm asmi saṁvṛttaḥ sa-cetāḥ prakṛtiṁ gataḥ ||
verses.translation: Arjuna said: Now that I see Thee come back in this Thy gentle human form, my heart is glad, my fears are fled, O Friend! and I am as I was!
verses.teaching: Arjuna said: Seeing this gentle human form of Yours, O Janardana, I am now composed in mind and restored to my normal nature.

verses.sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच सुदुर्दर्शमिदं रूपं दृष्टवानसि यन्मम। देवा अप्यस्य रूपस्य नित्यं दर्शनकाङ्क्षिणः॥
verses.transliteration: śrī-bhagavān uvāca su-durdarśam idaṁ rūpaṁ dṛṣṭavān asi yan mama | devā apy asya rūpasya nityaṁ darśana-kāṅkṣiṇaḥ ||
verses.translation: The Supreme Lord said: Yea! it is hard to see this Form thou hast seen! Very hardly shall a man attain to see what thou hast seen! The gods themselves look always longingly to see Me thus!
verses.teaching: The Supreme Lord said: Very difficult to see is this form of Mine which you have seen. Even the gods are ever longing to behold this form.

verses.sanskrit: नाहं वेदैर्न तपसा न दानेन न चेज्यया। शक्य एवंविधो द्रष्टुं दृष्टवानसि मां यथा॥
verses.transliteration: nāhaṁ vedair na tapasā na dānena na cejyayā | śakya evaṁ-vidho draṣṭuṁ dṛṣṭavān asi māṁ yathā ||
verses.translation: Not by the Vedas, nor from sacrifice, nor penance, nor gift of goods, nor works, may any mortal see Me as thou didst, O My warrior!
verses.teaching: Not by the Vedas, nor by austerity, nor by gifts, nor by sacrifice can I be seen in this form as you have seen Me.

verses.sanskrit: भक्त्या त्वनन्यया शक्य अहमेवंविधोऽर्जुन। ज्ञातुं द्रष्टुं च तत्त्वेन प्रवेष्टुं च परन्तप॥
verses.transliteration: bhaktyā tv ananyayā śakya aham evaṁ-vidho 'rjuna | jñātuṁ draṣṭuṁ ca tattvena praveṣṭuṁ ca parantapa ||
verses.translation: Only by fullest service, perfect faith, and uttermost surrender am I known and seen, and entered into, Indian Prince!
verses.teaching: But by unswerving devotion alone, O Arjuna, can I be known in this way, truly seen, and entered into, O scorcher of foes.

verses.sanskrit: मत्कर्मकृन्मत्परमो मद्भक्तः सङ्गवर्जितः। निर्वैरः सर्वभूतेषु यः स मामेति पाण्डव॥
verses.transliteration: mat-karma-kṛn mat-paramo mad-bhaktaḥ saṅga-varjitaḥ | nirvairaḥ sarva-bhūteṣu yaḥ sa mām eti pāṇḍava ||
verses.translation: Who doeth My work, and looketh on Me as his refuge, with no desire save Me, unbound to any earthly thing, and free from hate against any born of man, such an one, O Pandava, cometh unto Me!
verses.teaching: One who performs My work, who is devoted to Me, who is My devotee, free from attachment, without enmity toward any being—such a one comes to Me, O Pandava.

verses.sanskrit: अर्जुन उवाच एवं सततयुक्ता ये भक्तास्त्वां पर्युपासते। ये चाप्यक्षरमव्यक्तं तेषां के योगवित्तमाः॥
verses.transliteration: arjuna uvāca evaṁ satata-yuktā ye bhaktās tvāṁ paryupāsate | ye cāpy akṣaram avyaktaṁ teṣāṁ ke yoga-vittamāḥ ||
verses.translation: Arjuna said: Who are the most perfect in yoga—those devotees who worship Thee with steadfast love, or those who worship the Imperishable Unmanifest?
verses.teaching: Arjuna asks which path is superior: devotion to the personal God with form, or meditation on the formless Absolute. This question addresses a fundamental choice in spiritual practice.

verses.sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच मय्यावेश्य मनो ये मां नित्ययुक्ता उपासते। श्रद्धया परयोपेतास्ते मे युक्ततमा मताः॥
verses.transliteration: śrī-bhagavān uvāca mayy āveśya mano ye māṁ nitya-yuktā upāsate | śraddhayā parayopetās te me yuktatamā matāḥ ||
verses.translation: The Supreme Lord said: Those who fix their minds on Me and worship Me with steadfast devotion and supreme faith—they are the most perfect in yoga.
verses.teaching: Krishna gives precedence to the path of devotion. Those who worship with unwavering faith and focus on the Divine with form are considered the most accomplished yogis.

verses.sanskrit: ये त्वक्षरमनिर्देश्यमव्यक्तं पर्युपासते। सर्वत्रगमचिन्त्यं च कूटस्थमचलं ध्रुवम्॥
verses.transliteration: ye tv akṣaram anirdeśyam avyaktaṁ paryupāsate | sarvatra-gam acintyaṁ ca kūṭa-stham acalaṁ dhruvam ||
verses.translation: But those who worship the Imperishable, the Undefinable, the Unmanifest, the Omnipresent, the Unthinkable, the Unchanging, the Immovable, the Eternal—
verses.teaching: The path of meditating on the formless Absolute is also acknowledged. This approach focuses on the unchanging, omnipresent reality beyond all attributes.

verses.sanskrit: संनियम्येन्द्रियग्रामं सर्वत्र समबुद्धयः। ते प्राप्नुवन्ति मामेव सर्वभूतहिते रताः॥
verses.transliteration: sanniyamyendriya-grāmaṁ sarvatra sama-buddhayaḥ | te prāpnuvanti mām eva sarva-bhūta-hite ratāḥ ||
verses.translation: Restraining all the senses, even-minded everywhere, rejoicing in the welfare of all beings—they too attain Me.
verses.teaching: Those who follow the formless path with sense control, equanimity, and compassion for all beings also reach the Divine. Both paths lead to the same ultimate goal.

verses.sanskrit: क्लेशोऽधिकतरस्तेषामव्यक्तासक्तचेतसाम्। अव्यक्ता हि गतिर्दुःखं देहवद्भिरवाप्यते॥
verses.transliteration: kleśo 'dhikataras teṣām avyaktāsakta-cetasām | avyaktā hi gatir duḥkhaṁ dehavadbhir avāpyate ||
verses.translation: Greater is their difficulty whose minds are set on the Unmanifest; for the path of the Unmanifest is hard for the embodied to reach.
verses.teaching: The formless path is more difficult for those living in physical bodies. Meditation on the abstract Absolute requires greater effort than devotion to a personal form.

verses.sanskrit: ये तु सर्वाणि कर्माणि मयि संन्यस्य मत्पराः। अनन्येनैव योगेन मां ध्यायन्त उपासते॥
verses.transliteration: ye tu sarvāṇi karmāṇi mayi sannyasya mat-parāḥ | ananyenaiva yogena māṁ dhyāyanta upāsate ||
verses.translation: But those who, renouncing all actions in Me, regarding Me as supreme, worship Me with undivided devotion—
verses.teaching: The devotional path involves surrendering all actions to God, making the Divine one's highest goal, and worshipping with single-pointed focus.

verses.sanskrit: तेषामहं समुद्धर्ता मृत्युसंसारसागरात्। भवामि नचिरात्पार्थ मय्यावेशितचेतसाम्॥
verses.transliteration: teṣām ahaṁ samuddhartā mṛtyu-saṁsāra-sāgarāt | bhavāmi na cirāt pārtha mayy āveśita-cetasām ||
verses.translation: For those whose minds are absorbed in Me, I become the deliverer from the ocean of death and rebirth, very soon, O Arjuna.
verses.teaching: Krishna promises swift liberation to devotees whose consciousness is fixed on Him. The personal God actively rescues those who surrender with devotion.

verses.sanskrit: मय्येव मन आधत्स्व मयि बुद्धिं निवेशय। निवसिष्यसि मय्येव अत ऊर्ध्वं न संशयः॥
verses.transliteration: mayy eva mana ādhatsva mayi buddhiṁ niveśaya | nivasiṣyasi mayy eva ata ūrdhvaṁ na saṁśayaḥ ||
verses.translation: Fix your mind on Me alone, let your intelligence dwell in Me; thereafter you shall dwell in Me alone, without doubt.
verses.teaching: The first instruction for devotees: complete mental and intellectual absorption in the Divine leads to dwelling eternally in God's presence.

verses.sanskrit: अथ चित्तं समाधातुं न शक्नोषि मयि स्थिरम्। अभ्यासयोगेन ततो मामिच्छाप्तुं धनञ्जय॥
verses.transliteration: atha cittaṁ samādhātuṁ na śaknoṣi mayi sthiram | abhyāsa-yogena tato mām icchāptuṁ dhanañjaya ||
verses.translation: If you cannot fix your mind steadily on Me, then seek to reach Me through the practice of repeated meditation, O Arjuna.
verses.teaching: For those unable to maintain constant focus, the practice of abhyasa (repeated practice) provides an alternative path to devotion.

verses.sanskrit: अभ्यासेऽप्यसमर्थोऽसि मत्कर्मपरमो भव। मदर्थमपि कर्माणि कुर्वन्सिद्धिमवाप्स्यसि॥
verses.transliteration: abhyāse 'py asamartho 'si mat-karma-paramo bhava | mad-artham api karmāṇi kurvan siddhim avāpsyasi ||
verses.translation: If you are unable even to practice, then dedicate yourself to work for Me; by performing actions for My sake, you shall attain perfection.
verses.teaching: A third option for those unable to meditate: perform all actions as service to God. Selfless action dedicated to the Divine leads to spiritual attainment.

verses.sanskrit: अथैतदप्यशक्तोऽसि कर्तुं मद्योगमाश्रितः। सर्वकर्मफलत्यागं ततः कुरु यतात्मवान्॥
verses.transliteration: athaitad apy aśakto 'si kartuṁ mad-yogam āśritaḥ | sarva-karma-phala-tyāgaṁ tataḥ kuru yatātmavān ||
verses.translation: If you are unable to do even this, then take refuge in devotion to Me and renounce the fruits of all actions, with self-control.
verses.teaching: The final option: simply let go of attachment to the results of actions. This surrender of outcomes, done with self-restraint, is accessible to all.

verses.sanskrit: श्रेयो हि ज्ञानमभ्यासाज्ज्ञानाद्ध्यानं विशिष्यते। ध्यानात्कर्मफलत्यागस्त्यागाच्छान्तिरनन्तरम्॥
verses.transliteration: śreyo hi jñānam abhyāsāj jñānād dhyānaṁ viśiṣyate | dhyānāt karma-phala-tyāgas tyāgāc chāntir anantaram ||
verses.translation: Knowledge is superior to mechanical practice; meditation is superior to knowledge; renunciation of the fruits of action is superior to meditation—from such renunciation comes peace immediately.
verses.teaching: A hierarchy of practices is established: understanding surpasses rote practice, meditation surpasses mere knowledge, and surrender of results brings immediate peace.

verses.sanskrit: अद्वेष्टा सर्वभूतानां मैत्रः करुण एव च। निर्ममो निरहङ्कारः समदुःखसुखः क्षमी॥
verses.transliteration: adveṣṭā sarva-bhūtānāṁ maitraḥ karuṇa eva ca | nirmamo nirahaṅkāraḥ sama-duḥkha-sukhaḥ kṣamī ||
verses.translation: One who hates no being, who is friendly and compassionate, free from possessiveness and ego, even-minded in pain and pleasure, forgiving—
verses.teaching: The qualities of a true devotee begin with universal non-hatred, friendliness, compassion, freedom from ownership and ego, equanimity, and forgiveness.

verses.sanskrit: सन्तुष्टः सततं योगी यतात्मा दृढनिश्चयः। मय्यर्पितमनोबुद्धिर्यो मद्भक्तः स मे प्रियः॥
verses.transliteration: santuṣṭaḥ satataṁ yogī yatātmā dṛḍha-niścayaḥ | mayy arpita-mano-buddhir yo mad-bhaktaḥ sa me priyaḥ ||
verses.translation: Ever content, steadfast in meditation, self-controlled, possessed of firm conviction, with mind and intellect dedicated to Me—such a devotee is dear to Me.
verses.teaching: Additional qualities include contentment, constant practice, self-control, unwavering determination, and complete dedication of mind and intelligence to God.

verses.sanskrit: यस्मान्नोद्विजते लोको लोकान्नोद्विजते च यः। हर्षामर्षभयोद्वेगैर्मुक्तो यः स च मे प्रियः॥
verses.transliteration: yasmān nodvijate loko lokān nodvijate ca yaḥ | harṣāmarṣa-bhayodvegair mukto yaḥ sa ca me priyaḥ ||
verses.translation: One who causes no disturbance to the world and is not disturbed by the world, who is free from joy, envy, fear, and anxiety—such a one is dear to Me.
verses.teaching: A devotee neither troubles others nor is troubled by others. Freedom from extreme emotions—elation, anger, fear, and agitation—marks spiritual maturity.

verses.sanskrit: अनपेक्षः शुचिर्दक्ष उदासीनो गतव्यथः। सर्वारम्भपरित्यागी यो मद्भक्तः स मे प्रियः॥
verses.transliteration: anapekṣaḥ śucir dakṣa udāsīno gata-vyathaḥ | sarvārambha-parityāgī yo mad-bhaktaḥ sa me priyaḥ ||
verses.translation: One who is free from desires, pure, skillful, unconcerned, untroubled, renouncing all undertakings—such a devotee is dear to Me.
verses.teaching: The devotee is characterized by desirelessness, purity, competence, detachment, freedom from distress, and renunciation of personal agendas.

verses.sanskrit: यो न हृष्यति न द्वेष्टि न शोचति न काङ्क्षति। शुभाशुभपरित्यागी भक्तिमान्यः स मे प्रियः॥
verses.transliteration: yo na hṛṣyati na dveṣṭi na śocati na kāṅkṣati | śubhāśubha-parityāgī bhaktimān yaḥ sa me priyaḥ ||
verses.translation: One who neither rejoices nor hates, neither grieves nor desires, renouncing both good and evil fortune, full of devotion—such a one is dear to Me.
verses.teaching: True devotion includes equanimity toward all circumstances. The devotee remains balanced through fortune and misfortune, maintaining steady devotion throughout.

verses.sanskrit: समः शत्रौ च मित्रे च तथा मानापमानयोः। शीतोष्णसुखदुःखेषु समः सङ्गविवर्जितः॥
verses.transliteration: samaḥ śatrau ca mitre ca tathā mānāpamānayoḥ | śītoṣṇa-sukha-duḥkheṣu samaḥ saṅga-vivarjitaḥ ||
verses.translation: Alike to friend and foe, also in honor and dishonor, in cold and heat, pleasure and pain, free from attachment—
verses.teaching: Perfect equanimity extends to all dualities: friend and enemy, honor and disgrace, comfort and discomfort. Detachment from all pairs of opposites marks inner freedom.

verses.sanskrit: तुल्यनिन्दास्तुतिर्मौनी सन्तुष्टो येन केनचित्। अनिकेतः स्थिरमतिर्भक्तिमान्मे प्रियो नरः॥
verses.transliteration: tulya-nindā-stutir maunī santuṣṭo yena kenacit | aniketaḥ sthira-matir bhaktimān me priyo naraḥ ||
verses.translation: Equal in censure and praise, silent, content with whatever comes, homeless, steady-minded, full of devotion—such a person is dear to Me.
verses.teaching: The devotee treats criticism and praise equally, speaks little, accepts whatever circumstances arise, remains unattached to place, maintains mental stability, and is filled with devotion.

verses.sanskrit: ये तु धर्म्यामृतमिदं यथोक्तं पर्युपासते। श्रद्दधाना मत्परमा भक्तास्तेऽतीव मे प्रियाः॥
verses.transliteration: ye tu dharmyāmṛtam idaṁ yathoktaṁ paryupāsate | śraddadhānā mat-paramā bhaktās te 'tīva me priyāḥ ||
verses.translation: But those who follow this immortal dharma as described, with faith, regarding Me as supreme—those devotees are supremely dear to Me.
verses.teaching: Those who practice these teachings with faith, making God their highest goal, are most beloved. The chapter concludes by emphasizing the supreme value of devoted living.

verses.sanskrit: अर्जुन उवाच प्रकृतिं पुरुषं चैव क्षेत्रं क्षेत्रज्ञमेव च। एतद्वेदितुमिच्छामि ज्ञानं ज्ञेयं च केशव॥
verses.transliteration: arjuna uvāca prakṛtiṁ puruṣaṁ caiva kṣetraṁ kṣetra-jñam eva ca | etad veditum icchāmi jñānaṁ jñeyaṁ ca keśava ||
verses.translation: Arjuna said: I wish to learn about nature and the spirit, about the field and the knower of the field, about knowledge and that which is to be known, O Keshava.
verses.teaching: Arjuna asks Krishna to explain the fundamental dualities: prakriti (nature/matter) and purusha (spirit/consciousness), the field (body) and the knower of the field (soul), knowledge and the object of knowledge.

verses.sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच इदं शरीरं कौन्तेय क्षेत्रमित्यभिधीयते। एतद्यो वेत्ति तं प्राहुः क्षेत्रज्ञ इति तद्विदः॥
verses.transliteration: śrī-bhagavān uvāca idaṁ śarīraṁ kaunteya kṣetram ity abhidhīyate | etad yo vetti taṁ prāhuḥ kṣetra-jña iti tad-vidaḥ ||
verses.translation: The Supreme Lord said: This body, O son of Kunti, is called the field; one who knows this is called the knower of the field by those who know.
verses.teaching: The body is the field where experiences occur, and the consciousness that perceives these experiences is the knower of the field. Understanding this distinction is fundamental to spiritual wisdom.

verses.sanskrit: क्षेत्रज्ञं चापि मां विद्धि सर्वक्षेत्रेषु भारत। क्षेत्रक्षेत्रज्ञयोर्ज्ञानं यत्तज्ज्ञानं मतं मम॥
verses.transliteration: kṣetra-jñaṁ cāpi māṁ viddhi sarva-kṣetreṣu bhārata | kṣetra-kṣetrajñayor jñānaṁ yat taj jñānaṁ mataṁ mama ||
verses.translation: Know Me to be the knower of the field in all fields, O Bharata. Knowledge of the field and the knower of the field—that I consider to be true knowledge.
verses.teaching: The Supreme Self is the ultimate knower present in all bodies. True knowledge consists of understanding the distinction and relationship between the field (body) and its knower (consciousness).

verses.sanskrit: तत्क्षेत्रं यच्च यादृक्च यद्विकारि यतश्च यत्। स च यो यत्प्रभावश्च तत्समासेन मे शृणु॥
verses.transliteration: tat kṣetraṁ yac ca yādṛk ca yad-vikāri yataś ca yat | sa ca yo yat-prabhāvaś ca tat samāsena me śṛṇu ||
verses.translation: What that field is, of what nature, what its modifications are, whence it comes, who the knower is, and what his powers—hear all this briefly from Me.
verses.teaching: Krishna promises to explain comprehensively: the nature of the field, its characteristics, transformations, origin, the identity of the knower, and the knower's powers.

verses.sanskrit: ऋषिभिर्बहुधा गीतं छन्दोभिर्विविधैः पृथक्। ब्रह्मसूत्रपदैश्चैव हेतुमद्भिर्विनिश्चितैः॥
verses.transliteration: ṛṣibhir bahudhā gītaṁ chandobhir vividhaiḥ pṛthak | brahma-sūtra-padaiś caiva hetumadbhir viniścitaiḥ ||
verses.translation: This knowledge has been sung by sages in many ways, in various hymns and Vedic chants, and in the well-reasoned and conclusive verses of the Brahma Sutras.
verses.teaching: The teachings about the field and knower are not new—they've been transmitted through sages, Vedic hymns, and philosophical texts like the Brahma Sutras, establishing their authority.

verses.sanskrit: महाभूतान्यहङ्कारो बुद्धिरव्यक्तमेव च। इन्द्रियाणि दशैकं च पञ्च चेन्द्रियगोचराः॥
verses.transliteration: mahā-bhūtāny ahaṅkāro buddhir avyaktam eva ca | indriyāṇi daśaikaṁ ca pañca cendriya-gocarāḥ ||
verses.translation: The great elements, egoism, intellect, the unmanifest, the ten senses, the mind, and the five sense objects—
verses.teaching: The field consists of: five great elements (earth, water, fire, air, ether), ego, intellect, unmanifest matter, ten senses (five of perception, five of action), mind, and five sense objects (sound, touch, form, taste, smell).

verses.sanskrit: इच्छा द्वेषः सुखं दुःखं सङ्घातश्चेतना धृतिः। एतत्क्षेत्रं समासेन सविकारमुदाहृतम्॥
verses.transliteration: icchā dveṣaḥ sukhaṁ duḥkhaṁ saṅghātaś cetanā dhṛtiḥ | etat kṣetraṁ samāsena sa-vikāram udāhṛtam ||
verses.translation: Desire, aversion, pleasure, pain, the aggregate body, consciousness, and fortitude—this field with its modifications is briefly described.
verses.teaching: The field also includes psychological elements: desire, hatred, pleasure, pain, the bodily aggregate, consciousness, and determination. Together these constitute the complete field of experience.

verses.sanskrit: अमानित्वमदम्भित्वमहिंसा क्षान्तिरार्जवम्। आचार्योपासनं शौचं स्थैर्यमात्मविनिग्रहः॥
verses.transliteration: amānitvam adambhitvam ahiṁsā kṣāntir ārjavam | ācāryopāsanaṁ śaucaṁ sthairyam ātma-vinigrahaḥ ||
verses.translation: Humility, unpretentiousness, non-violence, forgiveness, uprightness, service to the teacher, purity, steadfastness, self-control—
verses.teaching: The qualities of knowledge begin with: freedom from pride and hypocrisy, non-violence, patience, sincerity, reverence for the teacher, cleanliness, constancy, and self-mastery.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रियार्थेषु वैराग्यमनहङ्कार एव च। जन्ममृत्युजराव्याधिदुःखदोषानुदर्शनम्॥
verses.transliteration: indriyārtheṣu vairāgyam anahaṅkāra eva ca | janma-mṛtyu-jarā-vyādhi-duḥkha-doṣānudarśanam ||
verses.translation: Dispassion toward sense objects, absence of ego, perception of the evil of birth, death, old age, sickness, and suffering—
verses.teaching: Further qualities include: detachment from sensory pleasures, freedom from egotism, and clear recognition of the suffering inherent in birth, death, aging, and disease.

verses.sanskrit: असक्तिरनभिष्वङ्गः पुत्रदारगृहादिषु। नित्यं च समचित्तत्वमिष्टानिष्टोपपत्तिषु॥
verses.transliteration: asaktir anabhiṣvaṅgaḥ putra-dāra-gṛhādiṣu | nityaṁ ca sama-cittatvam iṣṭāniṣṭopapattiṣu ||
verses.translation: Non-attachment, absence of clinging to son, wife, home, and the like, constant even-mindedness in desirable and undesirable events—
verses.teaching: Knowledge includes non-attachment to family and possessions, and maintaining equanimity whether circumstances are favorable or unfavorable.

verses.sanskrit: मयि चानन्ययोगेन भक्तिरव्यभिचारिणी। विविक्तदेशसेवित्वमरतिर्जनसंसदि॥
verses.transliteration: mayi cānanya-yogena bhaktir avyabhicāriṇī | vivikta-deśa-sevitvam aratir jana-saṁsadi ||
verses.translation: Unswerving devotion to Me through single-minded yoga, resort to solitary places, distaste for the company of crowds—
verses.teaching: Essential qualities include: unwavering devotion to God through exclusive focus, preference for solitude, and disinterest in large social gatherings.

verses.sanskrit: अध्यात्मज्ञाननित्यत्वं तत्त्वज्ञानार्थदर्शनम्। एतज्ज्ञानमिति प्रोक्तमज्ञानं यदतोऽन्यथा॥
verses.transliteration: adhyātma-jñāna-nityatvaṁ tattva-jñānārtha-darśanam | etaj jñānam iti proktam ajñānaṁ yad ato 'nyathā ||
verses.translation: Constancy in Self-knowledge, insight into the purpose of true knowledge—this is declared to be knowledge; what is opposed to this is ignorance.
verses.teaching: True knowledge means constant awareness of the Self and understanding the goal of spiritual wisdom. Anything contrary to these qualities constitutes ignorance.

verses.sanskrit: ज्ञेयं यत्तत्प्रवक्ष्यामि यज्ज्ञात्वामृतमश्नुते। अनादिमत्परं ब्रह्म न सत्तन्नासदुच्यते॥
verses.transliteration: jñeyaṁ yat tat pravakṣyāmi yaj jñātvāmṛtam aśnute | anādi mat-paraṁ brahma na sat tan nāsad ucyate ||
verses.translation: I shall now describe that which is to be known, knowing which one attains immortality—the beginningless Supreme Brahman, which is called neither being nor non-being.
verses.teaching: The object of knowledge—Brahman—transcends ordinary categories. It is beginningless, supreme, beyond existence and non-existence, and knowing it brings immortality.

verses.sanskrit: सर्वतः पाणिपादं तत्सर्वतोऽक्षिशिरोमुखम्। सर्वतः श्रुतिमल्लोके सर्वमावृत्य तिष्ठति॥
verses.transliteration: sarvataḥ pāṇi-pādaṁ tat sarvato 'kṣi-śiro-mukham | sarvataḥ śrutimal loke sarvam āvṛtya tiṣṭhati ||
verses.translation: Everywhere having hands and feet, everywhere having eyes, heads, and faces, everywhere having ears, It exists enveloping all in the world.
verses.teaching: Brahman pervades all existence—it is the hands in all hands, the eyes in all eyes, the ears in all ears. The Divine presence encompasses and permeates everything.

verses.sanskrit: सर्वेन्द्रियगुणाभासं सर्वेन्द्रियविवर्जितम्। असक्तं सर्वभृच्चैव निर्गुणं गुणभोक्तृ च॥
verses.transliteration: sarvendriya-guṇābhāsaṁ sarvendriya-vivarjitam | asaktaṁ sarva-bhṛc caiva nirguṇaṁ guṇa-bhoktṛ ca ||
verses.translation: Perceiving through all senses yet devoid of all senses, unattached yet sustaining all, beyond the qualities yet experiencing the qualities—
verses.teaching: Brahman appears to possess all sensory functions yet has no sense organs, supports everything yet remains unattached, transcends all qualities yet seems to experience them.

verses.sanskrit: बहिरन्तश्च भूतानामचरं चरमेव च। सूक्ष्मत्वात्तदविज्ञेयं दूरस्थं चान्तिके च तत्॥
verses.transliteration: bahir antaś ca bhūtānām acaraṁ caram eva ca | sūkṣmatvāt tad avijñeyaṁ dūra-sthaṁ cāntike ca tat ||
verses.translation: Outside and inside all beings, unmoving and also moving, too subtle to be known, far away yet very near—
verses.teaching: Brahman exists both outside and within all creatures, is simultaneously still and in motion, is too subtle for ordinary perception, and is paradoxically both distant and intimately close.

verses.sanskrit: अविभक्तं च भूतेषु विभक्तमिव च स्थितम्। भूतभर्तृ च तज्ज्ञेयं ग्रसिष्णु प्रभविष्णु च॥
verses.transliteration: avibhaktaṁ ca bhūteṣu vibhaktam iva ca sthitam | bhūta-bhartṛ ca taj jñeyaṁ grasiṣṇu prabhaviṣṇu ca ||
verses.translation: Undivided yet appearing divided among beings, that knowable Brahman is the sustainer of beings, and also their devourer and creator.
verses.teaching: Though one and indivisible, Brahman appears fragmented in different beings. It sustains all life, dissolves all at death, and creates all anew—encompassing the entire cosmic cycle.

verses.sanskrit: ज्योतिषामपि तज्ज्योतिस्तमसः परमुच्यते। ज्ञानं ज्ञेयं ज्ञानगम्यं हृदि सर्वस्य विष्ठितम्॥
verses.transliteration: jyotiṣām api taj jyotis tamasaḥ param ucyate | jñānaṁ jñeyaṁ jñāna-gamyaṁ hṛdi sarvasya viṣṭhitam ||
verses.translation: That is the light of all lights, said to be beyond darkness; it is knowledge, the object of knowledge, and that which is reached by knowledge, dwelling in the heart of all.
verses.teaching: Brahman is the light that illuminates all other lights, transcends all ignorance, is simultaneously the knower, the known, and the means of knowing, and resides in every heart.

verses.sanskrit: इति क्षेत्रं तथा ज्ञानं ज्ञेयं चोक्तं समासतः। मद्भक्त एतद्विज्ञाय मद्भावायोपपद्यते॥
verses.transliteration: iti kṣetraṁ tathā jñānaṁ jñeyaṁ coktaṁ samāsataḥ | mad-bhakta etad vijñāya mad-bhāvāyopapadyate ||
verses.translation: Thus the field, knowledge, and the object of knowledge have been briefly described. My devotee, knowing this, becomes fit for My being.
verses.teaching: The field (body-mind), the nature of true knowledge, and the object of knowledge (Brahman) have been explained. Understanding these, a devotee becomes qualified for union with the Divine.

verses.sanskrit: प्रकृतिं पुरुषं चैव विद्ध्यनादी उभावपि। विकारांश्च गुणांश्चैव विद्धि प्रकृतिसम्भवान्॥
verses.transliteration: prakṛtiṁ puruṣaṁ caiva viddhy anādī ubhāv api | vikārāṁś ca guṇāṁś caiva viddhi prakṛti-sambhavān ||
verses.translation: Know that both prakriti (nature) and purusha (spirit) are beginningless; and know that all modifications and qualities are born of prakriti.
verses.teaching: Both matter and consciousness are eternal—neither has a beginning. All changes, transformations, and qualities arise from material nature, not from pure consciousness.

verses.sanskrit: कार्यकरणकर्तृत्वे हेतुः प्रकृतिरुच्यते। पुरुषः सुखदुःखानां भोक्तृत्वे हेतुरुच्यते॥
verses.transliteration: kārya-karaṇa-kartṛtve hetuḥ prakṛtir ucyate | puruṣaḥ sukha-duḥkhānāṁ bhoktṛtve hetur ucyate ||
verses.translation: Prakriti is said to be the cause of effect, instrument, and agent; purusha is said to be the cause of experiencing pleasure and pain.
verses.teaching: Nature is responsible for creating the body, senses, and actions. The soul's role is to experience—it is the witness that perceives pleasure and pain through nature's instruments.

verses.sanskrit: पुरुषः प्रकृतिस्थो हि भुङ्क्ते प्रकृतिजान्गुणान्। कारणं गुणसङ्गोऽस्य सदसद्योनिजन्मसु॥
verses.transliteration: puruṣaḥ prakṛti-stho hi bhuṅkte prakṛti-jān guṇān | kāraṇaṁ guṇa-saṅgo 'sya sad-asad-yoni-janmasu ||
verses.translation: The spirit dwelling in nature experiences the qualities born of nature; attachment to these qualities causes birth in good and evil wombs.
verses.teaching: The soul, when identified with nature, experiences the three qualities (gunas). This attachment to qualities determines whether one is born into favorable or unfavorable circumstances.

verses.sanskrit: उपद्रष्टानुमन्ता च भर्ता भोक्ता महेश्वरः। परमात्मेति चाप्युक्तो देहेऽस्मिन्पुरुषः परः॥
verses.transliteration: upadraṣṭānumantā ca bhartā bhoktā maheśvaraḥ | paramātmeti cāpy ukto dehe 'smin puruṣaḥ paraḥ ||
verses.translation: The Supreme Spirit in this body is called the Witness, the Consenter, the Supporter, the Experiencer, the Great Lord, and the Supreme Self.
verses.teaching: The Supreme Self within the body functions as: observer, approver, sustainer, experiencer, great controller, and transcendent soul—revealing multiple aspects of divine presence.

verses.sanskrit: य एवं वेत्ति पुरुषं प्रकृतिं च गुणैः सह। सर्वथा वर्तमानोऽपि न स भूयोऽभिजायते॥
verses.transliteration: ya evaṁ vetti puruṣaṁ prakṛtiṁ ca guṇaiḥ saha | sarvathā vartamāno 'pi na sa bhūyo 'bhijāyate ||
verses.translation: One who thus knows the spirit and nature along with the qualities, though engaged in all activities, is not born again.
verses.teaching: Those who truly understand the distinction between consciousness and matter, along with nature's qualities, achieve liberation. Even while active in the world, they transcend rebirth.

verses.sanskrit: ध्यानेनात्मनि पश्यन्ति केचिदात्मानमात्मना। अन्ये सांख्येन योगेन कर्मयोगेन चापरे॥
verses.transliteration: dhyānenātmani paśyanti kecid ātmānam ātmanā | anye sāṅkhyena yogena karma-yogena cāpare ||
verses.translation: Some perceive the Self in the self through meditation, others through the yoga of knowledge, and still others through the yoga of action.
verses.teaching: Different paths lead to Self-realization: meditation (dhyana yoga), philosophical inquiry (sankhya yoga), and selfless action (karma yoga). Each person finds their suitable approach.

verses.sanskrit: अन्ये त्वेवमजानन्तः श्रुत्वान्येभ्य उपासते। तेऽपि चातितरन्त्येव मृत्युं श्रुतिपरायणाः॥
verses.transliteration: anye tv evam ajānantaḥ śrutvānyebhya upāsate | te 'pi cātitaranty eva mṛtyuṁ śruti-parāyaṇāḥ ||
verses.translation: Yet others, not knowing thus, worship having heard from others; they too cross beyond death, devoted to what they have heard.
verses.teaching: Even those without direct knowledge can achieve liberation through faith—by hearing from teachers and following with devotion. Sincere faith in received wisdom leads to transcendence.

verses.sanskrit: यावत्सञ्जायते किञ्चित्सत्त्वं स्थावरजङ्गमम्। क्षेत्रक्षेत्रज्ञसंयोगात्तद्विद्धि भरतर्षभ॥
verses.transliteration: yāvat sañjāyate kiñcit sattvaṁ sthāvara-jaṅgamam | kṣetra-kṣetrajña-saṁyogāt tad viddhi bharatarṣabha ||
verses.translation: Whatever being is born, whether unmoving or moving, know that it arises from the union of the field and the knower of the field, O best of Bharatas.
verses.teaching: All existence—plants and creatures alike—results from the combination of matter (field) and consciousness (knower). Life emerges where spirit meets matter.

verses.sanskrit: समं सर्वेषु भूतेषु तिष्ठन्तं परमेश्वरम्। विनश्यत्स्वविनश्यन्तं यः पश्यति स पश्यति॥
verses.transliteration: samaṁ sarveṣu bhūteṣu tiṣṭhantaṁ parameśvaram | vinaśyatsv avinaśyantaṁ yaḥ paśyati sa paśyati ||
verses.translation: One who sees the Supreme Lord dwelling equally in all beings, the imperishable within the perishing—such a one truly sees.
verses.teaching: True vision means perceiving the eternal Divine presence equally in all creatures. While bodies perish, the Supreme Self within remains imperishable—recognizing this is real seeing.

verses.sanskrit: समं पश्यन्हि सर्वत्र समवस्थितमीश्वरम्। न हिनस्त्यात्मनात्मानं ततो याति परां गतिम्॥
verses.transliteration: samaṁ paśyan hi sarvatra samavasthitam īśvaram | na hinasty ātmanātmānaṁ tato yāti parāṁ gatim ||
verses.translation: Seeing the Lord equally present everywhere, one does not injure the Self by the self, and thus attains the supreme goal.
verses.teaching: When we perceive the Divine equally in all, we stop harming ourselves through wrong actions. This unified vision naturally leads to the highest spiritual attainment.

verses.sanskrit: प्रकृत्यैव च कर्माणि क्रियमाणानि सर्वशः। यः पश्यति तथात्मानमकर्तारं स पश्यति॥
verses.transliteration: prakṛtyaiva ca karmāṇi kriyamāṇāni sarvaśaḥ | yaḥ paśyati tathātmānam akartāraṁ sa paśyati ||
verses.translation: One who sees that all actions are performed by nature alone, and that the Self is not the doer—such a one truly sees.
verses.teaching: Actions are performed by material nature through body and senses, not by the true Self. Recognizing that the soul is merely a witness, not an actor, is profound wisdom.

verses.sanskrit: यदा भूतपृथग्भावमेकस्थमनुपश्यति। तत एव च विस्तारं ब्रह्म सम्पद्यते तदा॥
verses.transliteration: yadā bhūta-pṛthag-bhāvam eka-stham anupaśyati | tata eva ca vistāraṁ brahma sampadyate tadā ||
verses.translation: When one perceives the diverse existence of beings as rooted in the One, and spreading forth from that—then one attains Brahman.
verses.teaching: Realizing that all diversity springs from and rests in the One Supreme Reality leads to union with Brahman. Unity underlies all apparent multiplicity.

verses.sanskrit: अनादित्वान्निर्गुणत्वात्परमात्मायमव्ययः। शरीरस्थोऽपि कौन्तेय न करोति न लिप्यते॥
verses.transliteration: anāditvān nirguṇatvāt paramātmāyam avyayaḥ | śarīra-stho 'pi kaunteya na karoti na lipyate ||
verses.translation: Being beginningless and without qualities, the Supreme Self, though dwelling in the body, O son of Kunti, neither acts nor is tainted.
verses.teaching: The eternal, attributeless Supreme Self remains untouched by action or impurity despite residing in the body. Like space, it pervades without being affected.

verses.sanskrit: यथा सर्वगतं सौक्ष्म्यादाकाशं नोपलिप्यते। सर्वत्रावस्थितो देहे तथात्मा नोपलिप्यते॥
verses.transliteration: yathā sarva-gataṁ saukṣmyād ākāśaṁ nopalipyate | sarvatrāvasthito dehe tathātmā nopalipyate ||
verses.translation: As the all-pervading space is not tainted because of its subtlety, so the Self, though present everywhere in the body, is not tainted.
verses.teaching: Just as space pervades everything without being contaminated, the subtle Self dwells throughout the body without being affected by bodily conditions or actions.

verses.sanskrit: यथा प्रकाशयत्येकः कृत्स्नं लोकमिमं रविः। क्षेत्रं क्षेत्री तथा कृत्स्नं प्रकाशयति भारत॥
verses.transliteration: yathā prakāśayaty ekaḥ kṛtsnaṁ lokam imaṁ raviḥ | kṣetraṁ kṣetrī tathā kṛtsnaṁ prakāśayati bhārata ||
verses.translation: As the one sun illuminates this entire world, so the knower of the field illuminates the entire field, O Bharata.
verses.teaching: Just as a single sun lights up the whole world, the one consciousness illuminates the entire body-mind complex. Awareness is the light that reveals all experience.

verses.sanskrit: क्षेत्रक्षेत्रज्ञयोरेवमन्तरं ज्ञानचक्षुषा। भूतप्रकृतिमोक्षं च ये विदुर्यान्ति ते परम्॥
verses.transliteration: kṣetra-kṣetrajñayor evam antaraṁ jñāna-cakṣuṣā | bhūta-prakṛti-mokṣaṁ ca ye vidur yānti te param ||
verses.translation: Those who perceive with the eye of knowledge the distinction between the field and the knower of the field, and liberation from the nature of beings—they go to the Supreme.
verses.teaching: Those who understand through wisdom the difference between body and soul, and know how to free themselves from material nature, attain the highest reality.

verses.sanskrit: मां च योऽव्यभिचारेण भक्तियोगेन सेवते। स गुणान्समतीत्यैतान्ब्रह्मभूयाय कल्पते॥
verses.transliteration: māṁ ca yo 'vyabhicāreṇa bhakti-yogena sevate | sa guṇān samatītyaitān brahma-bhūyāya kalpate ||
verses.translation: One who engages in full devotional service, unfailing in all circumstances, at once transcends the modes of material nature and thus comes to the level of Brahman.
verses.teaching: Unwavering devotional service transcends the three modes of material nature (goodness, passion, ignorance) and elevates one to the spiritual platform of Brahman realization.

verses.sanskrit: सर्वस्य चाहं हृदि सन्निविष्टो मत्तः स्मृतिर्ज्ञानमपोहनं च। वेदैश्च सर्वैरहमेव वेद्यो वेदान्तकृद्वेदविदेव चाहम्॥
verses.transliteration: sarvasya cāhaṁ hṛdi sanniviṣṭo mattaḥ smṛtir jñānam apohanaṁ ca | vedaiś ca sarvair aham eva vedyo vedānta-kṛd veda-vid eva cāham ||
verses.translation: I am seated in everyone's heart, and from Me come remembrance, knowledge and forgetfulness. By all the Vedas, I am to be known. Indeed, I am the compiler of Vedanta, and I am the knower of the Vedas.
verses.teaching: The divine presence within all beings is the source of consciousness, memory, and knowledge. All spiritual knowledge ultimately leads to understanding this inner divine presence as our true guide.

verses.sanskrit: त्रिविधं नरकस्येदं द्वारं नाशनमात्मनः। कामः क्रोधस्तथा लोभस्तस्मादेतत्त्रयं त्यजेत्॥
verses.transliteration: tri-vidhaṁ narakasyedaṁ dvāraṁ nāśanam ātmanaḥ | kāmaḥ krodhas tathā lobhas tasmād etat trayaṁ tyajet ||
verses.translation: There are three gates leading to this hell—lust, anger and greed. Every sane man should give these up, for they lead to the degradation of the soul.
verses.teaching: Lust, anger, and greed are the three primary enemies of spiritual progress. They are the gateways to spiritual destruction and must be consciously abandoned for inner peace and growth.

verses.sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच। त्रिविधा भवति श्रद्धा देहिनां सा स्वभावजा। सात्त्विकी राजसी चैव तामसी चेति तां शृणु॥
verses.transliteration: śrī-bhagavān uvāca | tri-vidhā bhavati śraddhā dehināṁ sā svabhāva-jā | sāttvikī rājasī caiva tāmasī ceti tāṁ śṛṇu ||
verses.translation: The Supreme Personality of Godhead said: According to the modes of nature acquired by the embodied soul, one's faith can be of three kinds—in the mode of goodness, the mode of passion, or the mode of ignorance. Now hear about this.
verses.teaching: Faith itself is influenced by the three modes of material nature. Understanding the quality of our faith helps us purify our consciousness and elevate our spiritual practice toward higher modes.

verses.sanskrit: सर्वधर्मान्परित्यज्य मामेकं शरणं व्रज। अहं त्वां सर्वपापेभ्यो मोक्षयिष्यामि मा शुचः॥
verses.transliteration: sarva-dharmān parityajya mām ekaṁ śaraṇaṁ vraja | ahaṁ tvāṁ sarva-pāpebhyo mokṣayiṣyāmi mā śucaḥ ||
verses.translation: Abandon all varieties of religion and just surrender unto Me. I shall deliver you from all sinful reactions. Do not fear.
verses.teaching: The ultimate teaching of surrender and divine grace. Complete trust in the divine removes all fear and suffering, offering the simplest and most direct path to liberation.
